title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @jimd8805
comment: This game deserved the review and helped make it better. When it came out, i spent less in 4 hours in it.  Coming back to the game again 3 months ago, a whole lot better. Npc quests made the game more interesting. You can now respec at level 25. You can start off at level 20 with a good build. You now get legendary perks start at lvl 50. 6 total all the way to lvl 300. Lot more fun to solo. I spent 359 hours in the game so far.  The game is still not perfect. Still quest breaking bugs that you have to force to work by logging out. Still have enemies that still get stuck in posing. Not very frequent, though. Can still glitch through doors(which makes launching nukes go faster). Atom shop has better stuff but some questionable why should I buy this. The game has a season mode to unlock stuff, which can be good sometimes. Holotape missions should be taken out. Its confusing to start new character with having npc missions and holotape missions. I would raise the rating from a 3 to a 6. Just because it still has its buggy issues and game crashes.  Overall, though, i would recommend for people to play it or give it another chance.  Im glad i did.  Are you still selling the 76 helmet?

author: @legrandtheiii2572
comment:
If this was 5 years ago originally, then yeah I'd 100% agree with Joe on this review. Much like every/anybody else who also jumped on the bandwagon for just how terrible FO76's launch, and overall gameplay actually turned out. 

However, now after the duration of time that's passed, I think it's safe to say for the most part this game's definitely in a much better state then it once was previously. Even with or without the current hype from the TV Series' recent airing, it's still been receiving constant updates and free major DLC expansions on a regular basis. 

Ergo, I pray Joe gives this another shot in the future, but granted it does suck for how long it's taken Bethesda...

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @tomster7574
comment:
the biggest mistake was forcing the world to play it online only. i stopped playing it when i got to level 20 and seeing other players pass by at level 300+ with me already playing more than 60 hours. i gave up. no more online anything for me, especially like this. 

i would have enjoyed it more if i could play it like 4 and vegas. i got tired of running everywhere to run errands and solve puzzles and mysteries and having to shoot my way on the way to each. so i used cheat codes, tgm and to run faster.  i got to see the story without getting so frustrated i wanted to quit. and i could go where i wanted 20 times faster. any faster you cant navigate in closed spaces. and i didnt die constantly needing to respond constantly which makes the game take so much longer, so much longer. oh so much longer.  if the game was made without shooting and just solving, it would be so much better.

even then, this game's puzzles are all over the map for just one puzzle. ugh.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @5IvanDrago5
comment:
Two things can be true. Is everything in this review correct and a viable complaint, yes.
Does Bethesda deserve the backlash they get for this game and their complete mishandling of The Fallout license, yes.

Is Fallout 76 a decent game with a great community in 2023, yes.
I recently returned to this game and am having a blast with it. Its not Fallout New Vegas and what Bethesda has done to the Fallout lore is criminal. However if you want to craft a plasma rifle add some legendary mods and melt some super mutants. Build a Nuka Cola themed disco base and run around dressed as The Silver Shroud, then this game is your thing.

This game, specifically the community is the goofy side of Fallout. Strange illogical bases, bright colored power armor, and nonsensible costumes running around and killing automated werewolves together with super jumping mutations. It makes no sense and sounds dumb, but it kind of works. Shit Fallout 76 is Borderlands, I just realized that as typing this comment.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Shorty_Lickens
comment:
My biggest complaint is the straight up lies about their technology. 
They did not completely remake Skyrim. They ported the executable from 32 bit to 64 bit, and since video games have almost no 64 bit instructions it doesn't really help much. The only bonus was 64 bit addressing for RAM which is nice because now you can finally put things in the game world that they promised before but didnt because of memory limitations.
And the lie their Creation Engine was all new stuff and could do amazing things. 
Its just a patch on the Gamebryo engine and mostly it adds some lighting effects. It does not fix anything with the physics or rendering engine. 
And after watching loads of F76 vids its clear they did not create or add whole new technologies to make a completely new game. Its Fallout 4 with a bunch of tweaks.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @stevendallyjr9468
comment:
Fun fact, I just recently learned it wasn't "quality concerns" why we never saw Prey 2. It was a petty battle that Bethesda picked with HH, having HH complete an alpha of the game, but waited on Bethesda to figure out what they wanted to cut and the next steps they wanted to take. The implication is that because Zenimax got the rights to Prey, they wanted to reboot it, but first wanted to make HH look like the bad guy and have them give up on the Prey 2 project. Eventually they did. 

What's more upsetting is, Prey 2 could have been a fucking all time classic, but after it's cancelation, we got HH to make Brink, Defiance, and eventually The Quiet Man. ü§¢ They made gold with Prey, had an all time classic get canceled, and than go on a ridiculously bad streak of bad games before changing the company's name. Here's to the a happier future for them going forward.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Manchu504
comment: I went to E3 when 76 was announced. It was a good time. I love Fallout and was genuinely happy I got to purchase some collectibles and do their Fallout "experience" thing they had going on for their boot. But I remember the sinking feeling I had that FO76 had a November release date, yet in June there was no gameplay information for the conference. It was a red flag and the "it's multiplayer Fallout" premise they harped on wasn't very convincing. I never picked up the game and likely never will. I won't let a Bethesda moneygrab ruin my naive fascination with the world of Fallout

comment: I remember one of Howard's underlings defending the no-NPCs thing, suggesting that players should adopt trades in the game. title: Fallout 76 Angry Review

comment:
Remember how they LIED to make us buy it?
Remember they said there would be Creation Kit and PRIVATE servers? -I specifically asked, otherwise I would not have bought it, because it would smell too much of what it is; a mobile cashgrab game. Which is why they lied in the first place. Remember "only cosmetic MTX"?
Remember Todds rant about "even the underground changes" when a nuke is used, making it sound like there was a huge underground system that would change like the surface? I was looking forward to this non-existing pipe dream.

They lied so much, had fo76 been a physical object it would have been illegal in most countries.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @chrismelekis5610
comment:
And still to this day the game suffers from (dont let comments it is actually fun now fool you)

1. It's a buy to play game, where you feel like in worst f2p if you don't subscribe to premium account
2. You want to sell your junk, but there's a LIMIT on cash you can get per day
3. You constantly find a lot of legendary eq, which weights tons, but useless for you. You can sell them for lottery scrips for a (small) chance to win something more useful, and guess what? There is a LIMIT on those scrips you can get per day
4. There is a LIMIT on what you can build in your camp
5. Cherry on top: there's a LIMIT on money you can keep on your character.
7. There is no way by intended game means to transfer valuables between your characters.

best way to make a fallout online,is this: just allow players to buy a piece of land, or a factory, or a port, or an airport... and build upon them, and let other lower level players pay to use these services i guess! or maybe buy/rent a house in your town! the town you built yourself! and maybe add some options to interact with your settlers or customers!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @slaebae3434
comment: At present day, the game is almost good. It's still bad. But almost there. Fallout just isn't a multiplayer game. Even fallout 3,4, NV, none of them were mainly combat based. Sure, they that element. But that is not the point. If I wanted to shoot stuff, I would play a shooting game. So, when you take a story game and make it online and add P2W features and remove a good story. You are left with nothing. The F76 story is almost worst than dog shit. At least dog shit has a value, somewhere in farming or something idk (Research?). So you have no reason to play it. UNLESS, you add end game, big boss fights, rare drops, stuff that will make you want to play with friends. My friends don't wanna run around for 5 hours listening to audio logs. The new "npcs" they added are lifeless and boring. They tried to fix it but it was too late. This game had so much potential. It makes me sad. It's like they have the tools, but just don't care. ES6 better fuck my wife and buy me a new car cause this is bad.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @jacobely6826
comment:
people cry about how bad this game is, which is fair but also i mean... we do it to ourselves... games will only ever become good once we drop pre ordering and first day purchasing on mass.

i havent pre ordered a game in a long long time because i realised that it just incentivises devs to focus on promotional material which will always lead to broken promises and rushed deadlines.

and this problem is just the same if instead of preordering people buy a hard copy on day 1 at midnight. i mean honestly you're just giving your money based on faith that the game will be good, wait a couple days maybe even a week or two to see if the game is actually any good and then buy it. this will make games like this be financially unviable.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @lodunost
comment:
Anyone looking to play this game now. Understand BUGS are still there. The crafting BENCH on where you get stuck and you can't fast travel is just so aggravated. 
There are NPC'S now but they are SO SO.
A lot of the issues that are covered here are still present in the game. They have added much more to the ATOM shop. 
You kind of feel pressured into FALLOUT 1st for the damn infinite scrap container because you can fill up way to fast and not have room its very much insane. There are much more negatives to this. 
Legendary perks are grindy and so if you want to change it costs  you all that progress. However you don't looks the progress on the card you change out it still costs you like 300 perk coins to rank another legendary perk card up which will take some time. Also much of them are useless and the worst part is about it they feel lack luster outside a few card that you will always want to have on. 

If you want something to just mess around in go for it if its on SALE. Other than that just pass this one up.

A major let down is the whole purpose of the game and it become obvious early on that there isn't much of a story. The game was supposed to be about rebuilding but anything you do in the game has zero effect. How can one rebuild when nothing stays built? It's supposed to be about wanting to co-op but there is little to no motivation to do so. Fallout 4 is a more fun and an all around better game...

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @justsomeperson5110
comment: Yeah.  I know I'm late to the party.  I only just found your channel.  But ... yeah.  If you didn't see FO76 coming a mile away though, you haven't been paying attention.  This IS Godd Howard.  Ever since he became the resident deity of Bethesda, his influence has been ruining their RPGs.  He has not a single RPG bone in his body.  Every new iteration of TES and now FO has been progressively worse in that regard.  And as Bethesda's fame grows, so have their attempts to overcharge their customers.  Now with added microtransactions!  It's ridiculously sickening to see the likes of the genius behind Daggerfall having fallen to the level of FO76.  Bethesda has always had bugs.  Has always bitten off more than they can chew.  But the innovation and depth and lore have always made up for it ... or at least used to.  But ever new RPG is that much less, while the old problems still remain.  And every new RPG has grown that much lazier and boring, polished to cater to "Mommy!  Can I have this?"  It's sickening.  I *hope* that FO76 was their much needed wake-up call, where Bethesda as a company learns to tell Howard the Duck to shove it and do what people love them for.  But I doubt it.  We'll see.  I will certainly NOT be pre-ordering ANY TES or FO game from Bethesda ever again.  I need time to scope their $#17 out and decide if it's even worth paying them for.  It's a sorry state to be in for Bethesda, but they did it to themselves.  I can't even JUST blame Coddpiece Howard because at some point someone should have stood up to him and told him to put his endless dick waving to an end and gone back to making games the Bethesda way.  The best thing that Bethesda could ever to for themselves as a company is take Todd Coward out of control of any and all RPGs.  Let him focus on action games and shooters.  It's all he is capable of.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @jasonmaxwell9762
comment:
I hate they sold this as if it was going to have open PVP. I paid full price and bought it for survival mode. It needed a few things to be fixed but it was better than nothing. Now that its gone the game has zero value to me. I even asked for my money back. I was like "since you removed a feature I paid for, I would like my money back" They told me to kick rocks. Could you image a dealership selling you a car with leather seats then they come back a few months later and give you cloth. I never had to deal with a buying experience where I paid for something and it was removed later. Thanks internet based games I guess.

Most of all I hate the Fallout community. They are the biggest snowflakes on the planet. I think this game had good potential for some replay value with survival mode. But the community whined about others players killing them so bad the PVP was striped form the game. They wanted it to be another Fallout game So bad, that's what it become. But it has no story or NPCS. This is because was never intended to be just another fallout game. it was made to have players being all the action and a PVP war zone. This is where the game had potential. If you remove the PVP. guess what? No action. You just have another Fallout Game your playing by yourself with no quest or npcs. But that's what the community wanted and that's what it became. A big empty war zone where you cant war zone anyone because the snowflakes want to smash robots with out being attacked. Go figure a post apocalyptic setting with raiders and monsters that can kill you any moment... but GOD FOR BID A REAL PLAYER KILLS YOU WAAAA!. Thats the fallout community in a nut shell. A bunch of sissies.

author: @dadnbud
comment: Revisiting again. I actually forgot this game never I mean...ever came out. No seriously. Soon as I saw online only. I knew it was a fail. Fallout is not an online game. People are not npcs. Everyone lone wolfs the game. I mean literally. I like having companions cause they are npc and reliable. People are people. That says a lot. Fun with friends. Anything with friends is fun period. A huge copout. So time went by and I actually forgot about this game. I  accidently came across this. I am licking my fingertips this is so good. It's crazy how people flip out cause they are fanboys. Defending their Bethesda game. Denial much?  I am a fanboy and this I knew would be shit. Then its shit. Then people denial. Bethesda it's not shit this is chocolate cake. Eat your cake. None of my friends. None of my family members bought this game. Even over a year plus later we still don't have it. This was easy to see as a cash grab. Then they wanna pretend it's not about the money that their name and their games alone sells. I am enjoying licking my fingers. Oh the I told you so flavor. This is so good. So funny.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @–ú–∏—Ö–∞–∏–ª–ë–≥–∞–Ω–∫–æ
comment:
I actually love how entire plot of Fallout 76 is broken:
Area of the game is a miracle on it's own, mostly untouched by all nuclear bombings, basically almost a paradise. SO WHY WON'T WE FIND SOME NUKE CODES AND LAUNCH SOME FUCKING NUKES ON IT TO GET SOME LOOT!!!
Also, how in the fuck loot generates there after explosion? Wouldn't it be better if every once and a while, one of bunkers to launch nukes would lag, and there was a timer in like 6-9 hours until nuke gets launched, so players get locations where code would spawn that is needed to cancel the launch, and when someone gets it, they have to get to the bunker before it gets too late, and abort the launch? And when any player does that, player aborted the launch gets some good loot from bunker, as he can use the code to open the armory/vault/etc. All other players present get some small rewards, based on what they done to prevent it: (Was looking for code/found code/ entered the bunker, but it was aborted when he was in). Yes, it would be random as fuck, but it would be more plot based rather than launching those nukes on basically healthy spot on earth.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @WarPigstheHun
comment:
Completely agreed about how ugly FO4 was. And skyrim. those games look like shit compared to Oblivion and FO76. I was initially repulsed by the idea of Appalachia. But then when I saw the actual ingame landscape i was like: "Damn. This is beautiful." "Even the god rays sticking out from those gray rocks are beautiful. Unsightly, and strange, but beautiful."

The way it is right now, I'd give it a 6/10. Most of it is landscape beauty, the fact that they brought back raiders and npcs and npc factions, balanced pvp to workshop. I believe bethesda's fuck up was promising too much, and not having the funds to pull all of it off at once. And it's true, fallout 76 is a massive game for it's time. They over expended itself. It's much better but I don't like that it was only this polished after 2 years of so much issues. But that's my verdict as of June 19, 2020. It's a 6/10. I'm continuing to play because I really enjoy the game, despite it's problems. I'm relieved to say that half of the problem sint his video were indeed fixed. I've rarely seen a T-pose (all games have that glitch, happens when a character animation gets a script movement error and it reverts to "default T pose"). Onyl problem is 1 quest so far is bugged. (Chloe refuses to accept the brahmin meat she asked for, so Io just dropped spoiled meat at her toes and left). And yes, enemies getting stuck is not unusual, but its thankfully not the majority of battles. I think it's when enemies spawn inside each other. I believe they should have spawn openings like in Borderlands 2 where raiders come out of their Tent flaps. If not, then just widen the spawn areas. If they could have a program that actively checks for bad npc spawns that would be great. I wish I could help them out but I'm no software/game developing engineer.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review

comment: You can respec now. You now have infinite levels, and can either pick card when you level, or move the stats around. Its a really respect system. forgiving but still tough.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @WarPigstheHun
comment:
In terms of why you aren't getting loot from vertibirds: they're protecting the real treasure (that tiny cargo bot.) The point is that they are simply bullet sponges that distract you from the actual treasure. You gotta shoot the cargobot thrusters, or destroy it's cargo hold arms so it drops the cargo, and you can pick up nuclear codes among other things. 

I was mad at first too, but now I understand that its not just a shoot and kill everything, I like it so much more.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @WarPigstheHun
comment:
I was wondering about the god rays sticking out from the rocks. They moved it higher but it's still coming from freaking gray rocks. I understand why though: Those rays can cause performance issues. So, in order to hit more people with LESS rays, they have ot LOWER it to our level. But that begs the question of: "Well why not have the ray follow you based on the location of the  sun itself?"

answer is simple: Not everyone have two 2080 ti's and itll look like even more shit if you dont have ray tracing technology. 

I like this game, and Im willing to play through the bugs so I can help improve it. It has so much potential and I get it, its expensive as hell to make these games. But It just feels SOOO rushed. Its sad because I can see they tried but the technology is just not there. We can blame engineers all we want, but unless we're actual game developers, then we don't really know the extent of the issues that can and can't be solved by the developers.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Deadsea_1993
comment: The game now is the best Fallout game. The updates fixed all these problems and the game does look beautiful cause it is X enhanced. He should do another review. I did everything in 3 and New Vegas and I wanted more of a survival aspect in future games like Hardcore Mode in Fallout New Vegas. This game did that. Amazing quests, like even minor quests blew me away. Like how a woman worked for a greedy mining company that had mob ties and her personality and brain was scanned into a mainframe computer. Then she was killed by the boss she was sleeping with cause he was drunk and she threatened to expose him. Your quest is to reboot the mainframe and fix the corrupted parts to set her mind free again. I clapped at the end of that. The community is the best I've seen in a game, very helpful. You can also now quest alone and mostly ignore everyone else and play it like a regular Fallout game

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @benjaminbeaudry8642
comment: I have been playing 76 since launch on and off on Xbox and have about 300ish hours. I got the delux pre order that came with the helmet and I felt really betrayed by Bethesda. Fallout 4 is one of my favorite games of all time and so I was super exited when 76 was announced. The world just didn't feel like a fallout game before wastelanders. I've now had about 20 hours playing wastelanders also on Xbox, and I have completed the main plot and some of the ally quests. Once wastelanders came out it felt like a whole new product. Lots of the locations were the same but it just felt so much more filled out and lifelike. The alloys (companions) are a bit of a disappointment, most of their quests are just, go here get this, or go there kill that. Also, some really well written and well voice acted moments are ruined by the bad animations as the gravity of things is lost when the npc's are limited to so few movement patterns. My final critique would be that you cant explore more than one option in a situation. I get that Bethesda wants to make players have to choose and stick with their choice but still, one of my favorite aspects of previous fallout games was the ability to quicksave before an important conversation and see what options I could explore. Too many times in wastelanders I wanted to say one this to see what would happen but didn't as I was worried it would damage my faction reputation of rewards later on. As an extension of this I would like the ability to try and kill every npc at crater or foundation. I thought that it was great in previous fallout games that you could just raid a whole town like diamond city just to see if you could. Yet, in wastelanders I cant do that because that might end my ability to associate with that faction. The grind to gain that status is so long that I don't want to risk losing that. Plus there's no real reward for just going on a murder spree (admittingly there isn't in previous fallout games either) so the game just kinda forces you to play by Bethesda rules when previous fallout games felt so good because you could make your own rules in your own world and cater the experience for what you desire. Wastelanders was a step in the right direction for fallout 76 and I am very excited to see what Bethesda bring out next (hopefully a price reduction on fallout 1st along with more new content). By no means is this game now perfect, there are still bugs and it is very much still fallout 76, but it is more on par with just a bad dlc then a burning fire of "microtransactions, the game". My pre wastelanders rating of the game would be a 3/10 and post watelanders 7.5/10. Both of those are not compared to all other rpgs but as far as fallout games go 76 may yet grow into one of the best!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @jacobpratt8546
comment: I defended the idea of this game for a decade with my friend and when it first realised I was excited and astounded to only be shortly met with disappointment after disappointment. My friend was entirely against the idea of fallout 76 and especially after Elderscrolls online, I defended the idea and held onto the fact that at the time when fallout 4 had just released that Bethesda would finally work on the rights for the online game that they won from the original creators. Imagine me and so many people who waited years for that game to be a reality only to be founded with a broken half baked game that had more than enough time to become a great and more complete game but instead wasted all of its potential. I borrowed the game, my friend returned it after a week. This game had enough time to be more and it didnt, no can defend Bethesda. If they mess up the next soon and it isnt at least as good as the original dooms cause I hold their doom above those then I'll take my business elsewhere cause I'll have no trust with them anymore. 1 game that was ruined that had deep seed, I'll give them one chance and I'm holding the bar low for them this time.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @abobodestroyerofthenes7840
comment:
‚ÄúPlayers don‚Äôt behave like NPC‚Äôs‚Äù 

Well not usually, but one time I actually found a guy in Fallout 76 who was pretending to be an NPC. It was actually pretty funny. The way he was talking sounded like a game show host or something. I don‚Äôt remember exactly what he said, but I think he was trying to help other players find Nuke Codes, as if he was guiding them on a quest... Don‚Äôt know why he wouldn‚Äôt just give em the codes, since he knows where they‚Äôre found, so he most likely already has them. But I guess that would ruin the journey if he just handed them out, and that wouldn‚Äôt be fun now would it?... Anyway, every time you ask him a question or say anything to him, he just keeps repeating the same dialogue. Saying things like ‚ÄúNo time to talk, we‚Äôve got codes to find!‚Äù and ‚ÄúFollow me and I‚Äôll show you the way!‚Äù exactly how an NPC would say it. I couldn‚Äôt help but laugh knowing that this was an actual person behind a mic, yet he actually sounded almost legitimately like an artificial or NPC. Not to mention because there was no push-to-talk and he had an open mic, literally everybody in the game could hear him yapping. I can only imagine how confused or annoyed other players were, especially ones who weren‚Äôt even following him in the first place. Which in my opinion just made it even funnier! XD

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @ConnorNotyerbidness
comment:
Within 1 hour of playing The Outer Worlds i figured out the secret history of this game and that game
Bethesda 100% was leasing the IP back to obsidian, but halfway maybe a quarter way through development they took it back. But bethesda still wanted a fallout game to show off so they threw one together out of what they had. Meanwhile obsidian said "we'll get our own fallout! With blackjack! And hookers! In SPACE!"
The outer worlds is a fallout game with a new skin (not a complaint that game is fucking phenomenal and had me crying just an hour and a half in)
So while fallout 76 was thrown together obsidian finally gave themselves enough time for the first time in history to finish their game. Even after the microsoft buyout.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @statosphereonline2008
comment:
If you pre-order their games after this fiasco then you are the cause of the problem.  They get their money because fans put their trust in these organisations after seeing flashy trailers of slick graphics and gameplay promises. They dont have to finish the game or meet any consumer expectations because at this point there are none. EA, Activision, Ubisoft are the same, too. At their core they are businesses seeking profit. If you give them money without needing to prove their product good then you allow this to continue because they sure as hell won't stop if you fund and tolerate it. In their world they are winning. Massive sales, big profits, no need to produce quality games that require hard work and planning. Why the hell would they stop? enterprises do not act on principle, they act on the most profit they can make with the least quality they can get away with. 

They wouldn't release a movie paid in advance because people wouldn't pay to see it until after the reviews confirming whether its worth seeing were out.

Reasons to not pre order:

-if the company refuses to allow pre-release reviews
-if they promise more than is feasible to expect them capable of delivering 
-if there is any mention of microtransactions being part of the core gameplay mechanics. 
- if the game studio has ties to a parent company known for putting quantity above quality eg Ubisoft and Activision- yearly releases are almost always going to be flops.

If you trust these companies and cannot wait till a few weeks after release for the reviews to come in before you part with your hard earnt cash, you only have yourself to blame. You are killing the gaming industry.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @chiquitadave3304
comment: Me and my dad were really looking forward to this game when it was coming out. Me and him have really different taste in video games. But Fallout was a staple series we both loved. When we heard 76 was online multiplayer we both looked at it as a sign that we can finally play a video game together. So I started playing at launch with everyone else and exited the vault to get ready to spend time with my dad. Only for him to not be able to join my game and me not being able to join his. Every time we were in a game together it would crash and when that was fixed we both agreed the game was ass. We havent played it in so long, 60 dollars down the drain and a few weeks of time wasted.

For 200 dollars, and now Todd has made it so if you want unlimited storage, and a private server, atoms and a outfit, you have to pay the cheap option of 100 dollars a year, because 13.99 a month is around 150 a year, and still hasn't fixed much to the game, I waited on giving my money for 76 because when I saw the ads that filled tv and YouTube commercials, I didn't see a game that would be cool by design, I seen a disaster worse than when mankind created the first atomic bomb in ww2..... I told my brother this game wouldn't even last half a month before it tanked, and in two weeks the price from 79.99 for the game alone, became 39.99 then 25.99, I'm surprised they haven't made it 15 or even 5 dollars, EVOLVE, a game that I paid 5.99 for, long after the creators, 2k, closed it down, I bought evolve because I liked the idea of the game, and I still enjoy it, and I paid 5 dollars..... title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @16goldnsilver
comment: My thought on the game is that it was purely made in order to help fund Starfield and Elder Scrolls VI. Clearly, there was a lack of passion behind the game and it shows. What I see is that since Starfield and Elder Scrolls VI are going to be such sought after title, Bethesda needed as much funding as they could get. So, what better way to get that funding by haphazardly throwing together an online Fallout title (which some fans have been wanting) and milking it dry. Although, I don't think Bethesda thought they'd see the kind of backlash that's occurring currently, which will only backfire for their upcoming titles. As someone who is a die-hard Elder Scrolls fan, it's always disappointing to see this kind of behavior from them. Obviously I hope things get better, but it's a tentative hope.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @koLourBlynd89
comment:
So... I just wanted to point out to anyone who is still around here for this game, that as of this moment 76 stands at $40 ($30 at some locations,) which is literally the EXACT same price as Fallout 4  at the same time, give or take $10. Fallout 4, a game that was released 4 YEARS ago, costs the SAME as a game that isn't even ONE YEAR OLD! smh... Personally I LOVE Fallout 4, to this day still, simply because I have modded out all the bad, modded in some good, and tweaked/patched the engine to my liking, and tbh it still baffles me how much flak Fallout 4 got when you consider the facts; New Vegas and Fallout 3 both used the same engine as Oblivion and those both got amazing reviews and opinions, yet Fallout 4 (and 76 tbh) use Skyrim's Creation Engine, an engine based on the Fallout 3/Oblivion engine of course, gets panned as if it was a terrible game and engine, when in fact it was a new engine and looked leagues better than both NV and FO3.

So AFA Bethesda and the whole Fallout 76 thing goes, I truly think they should just accept that this game did NOT live up to expectations, and while I am sure people would like to see an MMO built in the Fallout lore, I think this proves that a Fallout MMO is more than just a bad idea; it goes against what Fallout fans really want from Fallout games, which is a great story to experience in the virtual world. The sooner Bethesda realizes this, gets to work on a new Elder Scrolls and game engine (historically, Elder Scrolls games produce the game engines used for Fallout games,) the sooner a better Fallout successor can actually get released.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Calbeck
comment:
I STILL haven't played the game since about a month after it finally launched (was a B.E.T.A. backer FWIW), and I won't until and unless private servers are either formally implemented or HACKED into the code by modders. Even if all of the glitches and technical problems were fixed, my core gripe is that you CANNOT PLAY THE GAME AS INTENDED.


What do I mean by that? I mean the entire point of Vault 76 is "Rebuild America". You cannot even build a communal SETTLEMENT. There is zero collective permanence. Because you cannot guarantee getting back onto the server you last played on, and because everything you build goes with you when you log out, everyone is down to picking up and putting down their personal homesteads... and that's it.


The rest of the game is just a theme park with a lot of shooting in between. If I play it at all in future, the only way I would is as a TOURIST OF WEST VIRGINIA. Screw PvP, screw scavenging, don't care about loot, why bother? Not even death means anything. Just travel the Appalachains with a stove, a sleeping bag, and a rifle.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @AnaiBendai
comment: OMFG. Why didn't I see this review before I shelled out the money for this multiplayer garbage? First - the Bethesda servers bottlenecked me at 300 kb/s so it took 60 hours to download. Then when I ran it... I thought... omg... this looks slightly worse than Fallout 4. I have a Alienware PC gaming ststem 3.5 Ghz with RTX 2080 and I'm experiencing framerates around 12 fps in certain sections. Sometimes it just locks up for no reason while the persistent game world continues on without me. But that's ok - because the game world is DEAD. LIFELESS. NO one to meet - no one to interact with. What a horrific piece of crap. Why didn't they just make FALLOUT 5? Fuck this online only crap. So I decide to ask for a refund and I'm told... "BETHESDA does not offer refunds on warranties products" or some such shit. FUCK YOU BETHESDA. I rage uninstalled the entire game and Bethesda front end thing.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @jefthereaper
comment:
The worsed part is that Todd has a silver tongue, charisma/speechcraft maxed out all the way with most of the perks.
He can show you a turd and still sell it to you.

He's basically A version of Peter Molyneux who knows how to restrain his over the top statements and wrap people around his little lies and wordplay's.

I hate it as years ago I actually believed Todd was the spine of the game company that made some of the best ideas, much like Kojima.
Turns out he's just the talker that blinds people with sweet words.
The dev team does the real good work, and they are being forced to dumb down and reduce everything thanks to the higher ups that know selling a half asses game that's hyped up brings up more then a deeply invested polished product.
Problem is this will not make them rich on the long run and likely to run Bethesda into the ground.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @kris8977
comment:
You know what is the worst part of all this?
That Bethesda earned more money on this game, than Cd Projekt on his W3 ...
I'm from Poland and I love TLoU. Waiting for TLoU2 as hell ... I really love good games and good stories .
I have never played fantasy game before W3. 

But ... when i see the guy in his leather jacket on the stage with his beautifull haircut talking bullshit i think about one thing and one thing only "We bought this jacket and this haircut". So ... why the game studios as CD Projekt  or ND should care about good quality of Cyberpunk or TLoU2? When they really can sold us crap and earn money? We players as community eat shit . The truth  is that as gamers we really don't deserve for games as W3 and TLoU2.
ND and CD projekt Red and few others, do this not beacuse we deserve it. They are doing this beacuse they are true players. Not us. 

Sorry for my poor language.
Take care.
Greatings from Poland! :)

comment: The game... after trying and trying to get on with it is complete f**cking shit! IT IS NOTHING BUT  DIGITAL COCONUT SHY WITH ALL THE DAMN COCONUTS NAILED TO THE SHY POSTS... you try for a while but after throwing the balls hundreds of times as hard as you try the coconut just don't fall off... when a game is no longer fun, it is no longer a game.... this is utterly crap.... title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @alexissmetje
comment:
Almost rendered.
West Virginia.
Buggy servers.
No texture on the rivers.

Life is glitchy there.
2D paper trees.
Younger than their engine.
Here comes another freeze.

See-through roads.
T-pose me home.
To the lies.
That I know.

At Bethesda.
Howard Papa.
Glitch me home.
See-through roads.

All my memories can't build up here.
Stuck Mole Miners, standing on the water.
Dark and dusty, glitching from the sky.
Misty taste of Skyrim, from the .ini.

See-Through roads.
T-pose me home.
To the lies.
That I know.

At Bethesda.
Howard Papa.
Glitch me home.
See-through roads.

I hear his voice.
Every time when he lies to me.
The conference reminds me of old titles in my day.
And listening to him talk I get a feeling.
That I shouldn't have paid him yesterday, yesterday.

See-Through roads.
T-pose me home.
To the lies.
That I know.

See-Through roads.
T-pose me home.
To the lies.
That I know.

Take me home, Todd Howard.
Take me home, Todd Howard.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Corristo89
comment:
Why could the team behind The Witcher 3 make an absolutely massive world with hardly any loading screens (except when travelling between the zones (Skellige Isles, White Orchard, Kaer Morhen, Toussaint, Velen/Novigrad)) which ran very well, didn't suffer from game-breaking bugs, lived up to the promises made, and improved on everything from previous games while getting rid of the problems? And CD Projekt Red is a tiny team compared to Bethesda, which is a massive developer/publisher.


Actual QC? Making promises they could keep? Being quite aware that their brand is in danger of suffering permanent damage if they fool players again? Taking their work seriously? Spending more time on making the game than sending a self-centered manchild out to lie on stage?


I love Todd Howard, but I just want to smash his face in at this point. Here's a game which was released in the state of an advanced alpha, which took several steps back from a game which already took a few steps back, which is dipping its toes into one of the most difficult types of games out there (MMORPGs, which live and die with their balancing, stability and high-end content), which is literally plagued by bugs which were present and fixed in Fallout 4 and he's acting like everything is fine. Either he's completely delusional or on very strong drugs.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @TheREALSimagination
comment:
I think they did some things right, but those are game mechanics, new to this game and are only cool because they're practical and feed my ego. One is the scrapping of scrap and the other, though I gotta look for forever to find the one I want, is the way weapon and gear mods work, as well as being able to find complete ones and blueprints of them in the world and from vendors. The new legendaries vendor mechanic is, in principle, helpful and player vending is really cool but ONLY works, in theory, BECAUSE this is an online game.


Honestly, I think this is it.

After half a year I consider myself the winner of the group.

EDIT: Okay, after a few years I can say that I never expected this comment to blow up like it did. And for those asking: no, I never played RDR2 online and I know it exploded to oblivion. Still love the story though; finished it one day before graduating from high school back in -19. 
Here's waiting for RDR3, whenever it pops up. Try to stay safe, y'all!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @felixharrison6499
comment:
boy strap in this is going to be a long ass comment.... here we go.. oh and the stuff in () is side stuff and adds to the writing and provides explanation...‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.


Look I love fallout don't get me wrong, but Bethesda might have well shot themselves with this one, I really hope that fallout 76 is that "one game" that doesn't count for anything in the lore. 

Fallout, if continuing on its current path is marching toward it's grave. Command and conquer did the same thing, they had their amazing games, creating a loved universe for its followers and making a great genre of gaming, they had their retro first 2 games made by one company, got bought out by EA, had another game made C&C 3 Tiberium wars(with a few spinoffs, But for consistency's sake were sticking with the tiberium universe) with an amazing sequal game in the form of C&C 3 Kane's wrath.¬† but they made one major fuck up afterward, they bought into what other companies were doing, that's when C&C 4 was released, a retcon of lore, old gameplay styles throw out the window and built from the ground up (and not for the better).then after many community outrages and bad reviews, and a attempt at making things better via announcing another game(C&C Generals 2) that would be better going back to its roots. Then when they canceled it, the whole series died, C&C lost its identity and went away from their formula and payed the price, almost exactly as fallout is doing now. They had their OG retro games (Fallout 1 & 2) Their Bethesda games (Fallout 3 and NV) (And yes I know that NV was made by obsidian but stick with me here) now their version of C&C 4 has come about (Fallout 76) a game that literally went away from formula, fucked the lore, and utterly flipped off the fan base with shitty marketing and other bullshit like that Nuka dark, the messenger bag, and literaly everything else about this game (something that C&C didn't do, thank god) 

 Hopefully Bethesda wakes up and smells the coffee because if they don't, fallout as we know it is completely and utterly fucked. and no I'm not trashing Bethesda or fallout don't get me wrong, I love fallout, (I got so deep into the lore) but In the end I don't want the same thing to happen to another game I love to death like it happened with Command and conquer. 


Please for the love of god don't blindly follow what marketers tell you, and do realize that the universes you love can be changed by your actions!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @blazeoftherazgrizsquadron9306
comment: The only thing I can say in this game's defense, is that "GENERALLY SPEAKING" MMORPG's especially with a map of considerable size are prone to having poor and buggy launches. Things like that shouldn't be too harshly scrutinized in early release. I know when I write this it's later on and have made some decent changes and patches to fix those hilarious but immersion breaking glitches. But Bethesda studios did screw up pretty bad with fallout 76. They are better at making games with ACTUAL VOICED PHYSICAL CHARACTERS. But 76' screwed the pooch with it's idea of outright removing human/ghoul/super mutant NPC's. I like having a character giving me a quest rather than finding a fuckin holotape,  robot, or terminal that gives me one instead. The Nuke launching idea was an interesting and bold concept, but failed in making some sort of attempt to actually add some kind of terrain damage elements. (Me when I launch my first nuke at level 28)"Oh yeah let's nuke the Whitespring hotel and see what kind of loot lies in the wreckage" *Nukes it* "Alright probably nothing left of it" *Sees hordes of feral ghouls and building is completely unharmed* "WHERE THE FUCK DID ALL THESE GHOULS COME FROM AND WHY IS THERE A PRISTINE BUILDING HERE?!üò≤" like seriously, did I drop a nuke or an M80 firecracker?

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @JoeyJordison97
comment: I'm not even a Fallout fan. I've never owned a Fallout game. The only game I ever played was Fallout: New Vegas and that was fun tbh. However, since I want to get into new games as I'm tired of the same old COD, BF and EA Sports and 2k games I figured why not try Fallout. Fallout 76 *was* going to be my first ever Fallout game I purchased. Keyword *was*. This game was so hyped up and what a let down. I'm so glad I did not purchase this game. I honestly feel so bad for all the Fallout fans. Between the game being absolute shit, to the micro transactions (trust me I know a lot about both), to the fact that they literally ripped you guys off with the "canvas" duffle bag and the nuka dark rum. Oh and not to mention that platers got banned for no fucking reason and had to write an essay, yes a fucking ESSAY as an apology. It may seem like I've played the game a lot but I haven't in years. I just heard what was going on from AngryJoe and YongYea. Again, I feel for you guys I really do. And that's saying something considering 99% of my games are from Activision and EA. Sorry for the rant as I tend to do this a lot but if you made it this far, have a wonderful day! :D

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @NickSchoenfeld
comment:
Bethesda, I‚Äôm going to tell you a story, about a game called ‚ÄúNo Man‚Äôs Sky Next‚Äù and why you should be following their shining example, but you never will:

The game was released unfinished due to over commitment, while yours is due to deception. What you are doing is much worse since there is a big difference between over commitment and deception, and that difference is intent. Shortly after release, the Hello Games devs admitted their mistakes and redeemed themselves by spending the next few years improving the game (and they still are), at no additional cost and without micro transaction BS. Because of all this, Hello Games has been mostly forgiven and is now a respected company. If they can do it with a MUCH smaller dev team, why can‚Äôt you? If Final Fantasy 14 can do it, why can‚Äôt you? There is no excuse. This is why you have lost all respect and credibility. Sure, you haven‚Äôt had years to redeem yourselves like they have, but two months in, you‚Äôre still not on the right path like they were in the first 2 months. 

Those who don‚Äôt learn from history are doomed to repeat it. And yet, it seems you‚Äôre intent on doing exactly that. Remember Mass Effect Andromeda? There is a lot of history there.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @flightrisk7566
comment:
‚ÄúIf that many studios contributed to this project, maybe that was part of the problem.‚Äù Truer words have never been spoken. There have actually been treatises written on this subject: Google ‚ÄúThe Mythical Man-Month,‚Äù an entire manuscript written on management of development teams, one of whose core, objective observations is that more man-hours don‚Äôt equal a better product, and fostering productivity or good practice cannot be done simply by scaling horizontally. The hypertrophy resulting from such a mishandling of the team would only be further compounded by leadership obsessed with only deviating from old, outworn gameplay mechanics and formulae which aren‚Äôt well suited to a totally open world of tens or hundreds of concurrent players just so they could say that they did, and probably contributed to why none of the proprietary technologies and design Bethesda needed to build around the user experience of meaningful cooperation and progression almost from the ground up for the architecture of an always-online game pass cursory examination: The claims of ‚ÄúAll-new rendering technologies‚Äù are probably actually descriptive of where effort was invested because atmosphere is where Bethesda games have historically derived value and become exemplars. This is where studios  could have compartmentalized, likely had some personnel who specialized, and probably would have both made a stellar showing and released on time if they had been made to deliver the single player campaign promised to long-time fans, let alone revamped assets to keep up with strides made in availability and scalability of processing power under consumer‚Äôs desks. 

Instead these improvements are completely absent, as are updated mechanics to keep up with the responsive feel of innumerable competitive shooters crowding markets or cope with the technological demand of Planetside-2-scale real-time cooperative PvE. Bethesda failed to lure any new blood, and left die-hard fans with a bad taste in their mouth from the over-hyped and bungled implementation alongside the affront of simply opting not to release any of the aforementioned single-player. Sure Todd, you had lots of programmers. You probably managed to write lots of code. Programmers probably worked on lots of each others‚Äô code. In other words, you moved fast. But you probably also broke things. You made heaps and heaps of half-boiled, brittle spaghetti code whose engineers were too scattered by your release cycle to maintain. GG.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @TwistedMe13
comment:
At this point, ZeniMax needs to take Bethesda, find the people worth a damn (graphics design, lore [certainly not management or coders]) in the company and upon shuttering it-- send them to Id software and have them take control of all IP created by Bethesda. Id may have a few creative misfires over the years (Ie. Rage1, some of the older Wolfenstein games) but they have never lacked competent programmers. I'd certainly wouldn't have to fear CtDs every 30 or so minutes without applying a fan made patch to resolve bugs the company refuses to fix.
Ps. Their "Creation' engine needs to retired. Either use UE4 or Id Software's Id Tech 7 if ZeniMax wants to keep it in house.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Adam-tp6ch
comment: The most brutal thing about this whole situation is they made this game in about 1 week. this is fallout 4 copied pasted into a empty world space. delete a couple buildings here add a couple rocks over there. Presto West Virginia. Todd Howard admitted himself that with their creation kit it allows them to build complete cities and landscapes very very fast. With scrap everything you can literally scrap the ground and entire world space in about 1 hour. So lets be generous and say it took a week to auto generate the map. Cause that's what they do. literally hit a button and let the space create itself. Then they go in and move a tree here and place a rock there. Okay so moving on to NPC- 15 seconds. The amount of time it took to right click the NPC folder in fallout 4 and hit delete.  Clutter and static garbage in the game 10 minutes- 15 seconds to right click copy and paste. 9m45s to change the color on a few. the 3-4 "different" enemies in the game. We'll be a little more generous on this one and say a day and a half-36 hours. 15 minutes to copy and paste them from their other games- 35 1/2 hours to wait for email from Caliente(Outfit Studio)giving them permission to use Bodyslide- 15 minutes to add outfits to the ghouls- Not Scorch beasts- FO4 ghouls. Story line- 0 minutes. End game battle 30 seconds- 10-15 to copy and paste it in there- 10-15sec to decide which dragon looked the coolest from Skyrim. So where are we roughly now- a week and a half. Now we can be generous once again and say that it even took a year cause I did forget one thing- 50 1/2 weeks to figure out the best way to fuck us in the ass and integrate the Atomic Shop and how to creatively scratch every extra dime they can out of us. So 1 year. If there is anybody out there that believes their bullshit that 4 different studios have been working on this piece of shit game for 3-4 years non-stop GIVE ME A FUCKING BREAK. Wake up and smell the coffee. This game was literally made over the course of a long weekend to leach any extra dollar they can get out of you until they figure out how to make a quality game. Plain and Simple.

comment:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME
If you do, prepare to be MASSIVELY disappointed, even EB Games are warning potential buyers that game is totally unstable. In the space of 15 mins whilst having achieved L50 after 2+months, the game [DISCONNECTED FROM SERVER] 5 times and then refused access because "account not authorised".........it is a legit copy downloaded from Bethesda onto a PS4 Pro.


The game will start out relatively stable, then they will carry out "upgrades/servermaintenance", the gmae will become unplayable as a result for a number of days, then they will find a ptach to almost fix the problems, then you will get a period of relative stability (as in, you can almost get an uninterrupted hour before it falls over) before the next "server maintenance"......then the shit starts all over. It has been this way since the day I made the mistake of buying it.


You will NEVER get a refund - best advice is DO NOT EVER download a game on the net, in fact do not ever playonline. It's the only way to bring these arseholes to account

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @marijandesin8226
comment:
Does anyone seriously don't get the situation? 
The corporate financial is taking over (just like in Blizzard and EA a long time ago) and Tod is practically in a really bad situation where hes badly limited in resources but has to hype the product as usual. 
Do you seriously question his abilities after such a portfolio? 
He is a company man. If he said the game wad issues he would get fired and also net be able to get a job with anyone else other than open up his own company which would prevent him from designing because he would waste his time on startup and focus on management. etc. etc. 
Don't be surprised if he leaves. Everyone from Blizzard did. 
Remember that quote - "You either die a hero or live to become the villain" 
Such is the faith of all Companies and in life in general 
Google, Amazon, Apple etc. 
They play and have a genuine human line when small and starting up but in the end its all about maintaining power among other big fish . I haven't played Fallout 76, and while I get your frustration don't be blind to the realities of finance. We all wear it on our sleeve. Tod is practically held on gunpoint. Its like hes Walter Mitty and some new dick comes in from high above to cut down costs and maximize profits.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @8ZakattacK9
comment:
I didn't even want Fallout 76 in the first place. It took time and resources away from TES 6. I knew it was gonna be shit, but not to this degree. It isn't even an individual Fallout game. Looks more like shitty Fallout 4 DLC. We didn't need another Fallout game. We had Fallout 4(which is a pretty damn good game and doesn't deserve the flak it got), Fallout New Vegas, Fallout 3, etc to hold us over untill the next true Fallout game. We needed them to focus all their attention on TES 6 so it doesn't turn out to be a total flop like this "game". Fuck this game and it's stupid, unwanted, buggy, glitchy, trainwreck of a face!

Aso, a lot of the points you mentioned also apply to Mount & Blade Bannerlord. What a god awfrul "Early Access" game at $40, amost full price and the insolent fanboys that defend it even to this day are the definition of "delusional" and "double standard". Early Access games should be FREE to $5 MAX because you are testing a game, not playing it's full release. Valve needs to clean up it's early access games that are just milking players dry and have an EARLY ACCESS category to organize Steam and give the boot to early access games that will never be finished.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Thule-ob1vm
comment:
You know, I promised myself I wouldn't say this but. . . I FUCKING TOLD YOU SO!!! I knew this game was going to be absolute shit from the moment it was announced and NOBODY believed me! "Give it a chance" they kept chanting "Stop being a hater" they crooned, and a million other dumb ass non-arguments in the same vein. I love the Fallout series, but I call it like I see it and every Fallout fanboy who taunted and doubted me can now officially EAT SHIT AND DIE!! 
To the 9.5 thousand people who disliked this review: do the world a favor and either give up playing video games forever, or JUMP OFF THE TOP FLOOR BALCONY OF A SKYSCRAPER!! Every single one of you is a blind fanboy loser who needs to stop fucking up my goddamn single player masterpieces with your MMORPG BULLSHIT!!! 
You know I may actually have already left a similar comment on this video a month or two ago, but I can't remember, and don't care, because IT IS WORTH SAYING TWICE!! Fallout 76 was a shit game for brain dead morons in dire need of immediate forced sterilization to prevent their flawed genes from polluting mankind's collective intelligence! FUCK!!!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @tomhedlund4524
comment:
Shigeru Miyamoto warned us.  He said that when games went to (digital distribution), game companies would <paraphrasing> "ship first, patch later."  When I played my first PC game back in 1991, RAM was $100 per megabyte and a good hard drive was 40 mb.  RAM is now about $20 a gigabyte and drives are measured in terabytes.  All that memory and storage come at a steep price--rushed games, cash-grab Pre-Order content, micro-transactions and game companies owned by shareholders. ¬†

I had not seen Todd Howard's E3 presentation and interviews for Fallout '76, but now that I've seen clips in this video, I can tell that Howard was lying: 1) No gameplay video at E3, 2) Ringers in the audience who clap and cheer like they're at a political rally, 3) Almost no blinking from Howard in the interview, and when he does blink, it's too long--giving away that he knows he's lying.  I've seen politicians do the same thing.

One good thing is that Bethesda stockholders will dump their holdings making stock prices plummet.  That is a good time to buy stock--rock-bottom prices!  Bethesda can then use the influx of cash to build a new engine and keep their promises with ES Vi.

If you're unwilling to buy Bethesda stock, then you can help Bethesda make better games in two other significant ways---STOP pre-ordering games and never complete a micro-transaction! Make them EARN your money.  Oh, and you can also wait six months before buying ANYTHING from Bethesda.  Oh, I'm sorry, you WANTED to be a beta-tester for a full-priced game, my mistake.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @jarretthess1877
comment: Saying that your expectations weren't met with the game itself is just stuipd. Most the problems are with the severs rendering and processing all the players. That being said, a lot of those issues have been fixed (note I said a lot not all). NPCs and a great solo story couldn't be in this game because the way multiplayer games like this work. Other players would kill NPCs need for quest and it makes no sense to have them be invisible. If you don't want to just cheat the game by looking up codes or trapping enemies you don't have to. You don't often see players to began with so others doing this does really affect you. If you want to respec, you make a new character like in lot of other games that want you to put some thought into it. This game is met for you to become better by a better understanding of the game. Which means, you do well and have an enjoyable experience by restarting after you get to the point where you one shot enemies to reinvest your perk points in a better way making for a new playstyle. Their isn't a real great story but their is a ton of lore that you can find if you look for it making the game intresting. Lastly, earning atom is really easy, you don't need to buy atom. And the stuff in the atom shop is cosmetic so, whats your point. You saying that the game is bad isn't really true; talking about the servers is a little different. If you said that the game was good but dull at times, however the servers were buggy and took away from the experience, I would say that is much more fair then, this game sucks because it has bugs and I got to the point where it was easy.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @highway_roadkill
comment:
One of the biggest lore issues in Fallout 76 that pisses me off are the super-computer mayors and headmasters. It completely fucking nullifies the existence of President Eden in Fallout 3. He was suppose to be a state of the art post-War super-computer, something that humanity didn't even completely have before the bombs. He was suppose to lead the Enclave for years, not needing term limits and being incapable of human-error. But *_no!_* It turns out West Virginia of all places has these super-computers, while places like the fucking Capital of the United States doesn't.
I enjoy Fallout 76's gameplay. I can look past bugs and unfinished content. But when they retcon and incorrectly reference _their own fucking lore_ it really ticks me off, and makes me wonder about the writing capabilities of Bethesda.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @hiramabiff9138
comment:
So many people are Salty over this game, but I've been playing it without problems and have enjoyed every minute of it with my friend. The only real issue I seem to have, is managing my stash of 600 weight between my gear and crafting materials, and am kinda upset there's no actual NPC characters besides robots an shit. 

Other than those two complaints, I don't see where people get off; in all likliness they probably have no idea how game development works, and neglect the idea that many studios refrain from even making online games because of the testing needed to solve hiccups, and the complaints people give it anyways. Sure SINGLEPLAYER Bethesda games were more solid previously, but with online games, things cannot be fixed until servers and the game are worked out by players stress testing everything. Code may work perfectly fine until it is stressed. This is exactly why they just increased the stash from 400 to 600 and say they will continue to increase it as long as it doesn't effect the game. 

People bitching doesn't help solve anything, and if they blindly keep it up, we can pretty much guarantee Bethesda refrains from adding multi-player to their games in the future...especially when the fan base has come to expect too much because they have this molded idea in their head of what a fallout game should be.

This same thing goes for Assassins creed titles and many other games; Assassins creed Unity came out and despite being fun but half ass, people just bitched and complained and picked apart every damn detail (saying little about what was good), and since then, how many online/coop Assassins creed games have we seen? Despite people thinking that Bethesda is God, and how could they create such garbage when they are a legend company, people need to clearly understand that despite the quality of their past games, for Bethesda online games aren't their specialty...but that doesn't mean things cant change or get better, they just need proper feedback instead of all of this sheer hatred.

Everything about this game, including the fact that they didn't include human NPCs says that they tried by the hair on their balls to get a base working online fallout game that wouldn't be stressing by itself...and instead of people seeing the flaws and choosing to commend Bethesda for actually trying and for considering future online Fallout games in the first place...people just see the flaws and bitch some more. It's clearly because they know nothing about actual development, or they've never really played the game (its a fact; so many people talking crap about this game have never even played it). 

BTW, there are so many games worse than this selling for the same or more price, getting Fallout 76 even in the condition it is in and with the (few) problems it may have, is a steal for only $30. I'd rather have my money back for buying "For Honor" when it was $50 (the player toxicity I experienced and the disproportionate power between warriors made the game one sided and completely game breaking). I'd also like my $60 back for buying Call of Duty WW2 (having been a huge fan of COD WAW, in COD WW2 all guns felt like they did close to the same damage, while bolt action rifles took 2-3 bullets to kill someone and yet shotguns were 1 shell kills from nearly across the map, nothing was ever fixed and they only nerfed what guns were good)...

Before getting Fallout 76, I was with everybody else thinking it was garbage because of what people were already saying... but after spending many hours playing, I truly feel like people have their head up their ass and simply can't see the good things about the game... and that's despite nothing being what they advertised, 16 times the detail ect ect... Its like Nvidia always claiming their latest GPUs are 3-4x faster when it may only be 20-30% or so faster than the previous card, people have got to be ignorant (lacking in understand when concerning hardware) to believe there was that large of an increase... Same goes for Fallout; you'd have to be ignorant to believe they could get 16 times more detail over Fallout 4; its just stupid to even say and was clearly and undoubtedly a sales gimmick. Even with my little experience in 3D work and game development, I can say with 100% certainty before even seeing gameplay, that those words were complete and utter bullshit. This is why I said "ignorant", because these companies say things like 4x faster or 16x more detail, because they know that people who truly don't know better, will eat it up.... "But Wait, pay $19.95 and call in the next 15mins and receive a second copy for FREE! That's right, for FREE, just pay a small shipping and handling fee of $19.95" ... What can I say, some people are dumb as rocks.

comment:
Playing it over a month now. Past lvl 120 and still have tons of fun with it. All the stuff you bitch about like a crybaby isn't half as bad as you pretend it to be. If you don't like it? That's fine. But being biased just because of that and deny a actual good (but flawed) game some praise? Fuck off.

I really liked you. You were my number one source for reviews for the past years. But with this biased bullshit. This dogshit review you put up here, just to shit on Fallout 76 and cash in on the hate-train going on, that left a big dent in my trust in you with reviews. 

And you proven me right as well. You did let get Rockstar away with their predatory business practices that was with RDR2 Onlines microtransactions. Not even given a fuck about it. But you completely destroyed Bethesda for having some cosmetics in their shop. 

For that i desubbed from you. And everytime i try to watch your reviews now i will try to get a different opinion or even try the game myself in the future before believing you. Not that you should give much of a fuck yourself. Your fanboys with gratefully just jerk you off as much in their circlejerk hate-train. title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @logicdiary3179
comment:
Oblivion feels more completed and up to date than this new game. Wow, I'm so sorry to the fallout fans that they had to go through this mess. Seriously, though, after a company continues making sequels of the fallout brand, just gives the the same old same old, game after game. Bethesda robbed you guys with this mess. I've always been curious of the hype around the fallout series so I came to check this video out. I'm partial to the medieval magical elements of the elder scrolls over fallout but my younger brother likes the series so I want to have more knowledge of it (so we actually have something to talk about for a change). I see that Bethesda has capitalized on your fandom once more without more than minimal effort. This looks like amateur work. I've seen less bugs in a classic Nintendo game. I mean, wow, they ripped you guys off with this bs so bad. 
Just do what I do, go back to the classics; from before the time when post release patches were even a thing. Back when they finished the game before they deemed it ready for sale and distribution

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Nick-xv2bx
comment:
It sucks that people who've digitally bought the game are ultimately screwed out of refunds. I mean hell I'll even take a partial refund at this point in exchange for this dumpster fire of a game. Please TAKE IT!! Give me $30 and TAKE IT AWWWAAAYYYY!!!! What's even scarier is that starting this month, they're going to start releasing more content patches. What? Really? More content when you haven't even FIXED your buggy performance issues! Instead of fixing the problem, they're going to add more content that'll soon make the problem alot more enriched. Bethesda has released more than 70gb worth of patches claiming they'll fix their performance, glitch and bug issues but it hasn't.. those "patches" actually made game-play alot worse. 

Here are a few current examples (this all was on 1/2/2019). Enter power armor, crash.. Launched a nuke, crash.. killed a three star level 68 albino death claw; fell through the map (went back to loot and my bag wasn't there while trying to loot the DC and got the loading wheel of doom).. went to trade 2-3 star gear to a friend; game crashed and all gear (AAALLL TRADED GEAR) was lost upon reload.. entered in a nuke zone with party; all party members booted to XBox start screen except me (it was lag even-though we were the ONLY group in it).. fast traveled to my camp; half of my camp was glitched in the ground while walls on the other half were missing (that was actually a neat glitch because I was able to go into my camp and glitch in the ground to my forever falling doom lol).

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Urbankin
comment:
I think I cracked the deal with the Fallout 76.

The game is made for developers (modders), around an idea of potential. Marketing is done too aggressively in the assumption that the game has reached it's potential at the day of launch.

Sadly, this backfired hard. Relayed the development on community, since community likes to do that in the eyes of studio. Charging full price for doing the job for them is most backwards thinking you can imagine. Nevertheless there will always be those loyal for the franchise and driven to just  that. They should have let the community work on the game in closed beta for a year and then launch it at full price. Alternatively release 76 as $30 DLC for Fallout 4. That would have been wiser move that standalone claim as triple A title.

Developers like the potential of 76 as raw gem
Average consumer feels like he/she got scammed

I bet there is fundamental flaw within the Bethesda, it's lack of clear communication between departments. Extremely common issue in large companies that eventually breaks it apart. Development bloating the current state in front of owners and marketing department. Marketing takes that and sells it as the ambitions were actually true. Results are in, a product that ruins the entire imago of trusted company. You can see this happen in larger companies despite the field of profession.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @antonyduhamel1166
comment: The more I watch these kinds of videos, the more I realize that the only way we the people will solve this issue is by boycotting these game studios so their profits plummet so hard, so fast that even THEY have to notice. It's NEVER going to happen because spoiled kids with parents who don't know how to say no will always exist, but it's the ONLY thing that these asshats will pick up on these days. Could you imagine how quick Activision Blizzard would increase the quality of their product if Call of Duty: The Next One sold as close to ZERO copies as is humanly possible? No pre-orders, no sale of special editions, multiplayer playerbase of less than a thousand worldwide. They would TURN AROUND and SHAPE UP in SECONDS. They would look at what the playerbase is asking for and they'd DO IT. But it'll never happen, because people are too apathetic to affect that kind of global change. We could do it, if only we believed, but no one does, so it never will.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @RobertVlcek
comment:
Actually I just wanted to write two words that explain the game: Stock market.

I wasn't interested in the game from the start because of the multi-player aspect. But I followed how it was doing in the stores and I noticed that the prices dropped on an almost daily basis. It sells now for the same price as a game that's out there for more then 2 years - at least in my home country. 

The biggest problem is that publisher studios like Bethesda (as a publisher, not the actual game makers ) or EA are only interested in a quick buck at the stock market. What they get via actual sales does not really matter.
Only the number of sales. Stores could retail a game for the purchase price, the publisher wouldn't care as long as the number of sold copies are the "correct" numbers at the right time. That is why Andromeda was rushed out, that is why that other game your talked about was ditched and Fallout 76 copy-pasted together because maybe they could bring out that one by the end of 2018. 

Aaand this could happen again with TES6. 

Just look at the release date of a game from a major publisher like EA, hold yourself back for about 2-3 months (not primarily because of patching!) -and then buy with all the possible bugs and glitches. That will hurt them.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @konakoffee00
comment:
Cute when the LOD materials replace the game maps. And the navmesh glitches....falling through the worldspace - priceless!  Simply because 
one person says "it just works" doesn't mean it actually does. Delusional? Maybe.  Loved the audience's lackluster response to the cheaped-out no
 NPCs in-game, or better yet, human interaction which apparently consists of live people wandering the game. Killed it for me right there . Cheesy robotic quests?...jeez! And the bit about buying things to make it workable and up to par...the temerity of marketing greed! But clearly it appeals to those to whom winning is paramount - a virtual gauge?  Yet the reality of it all says it's empty and non-existent, nonetheless.

To be fair, however, there are a many games that could benefit from upgrades, patches and mods. But am duly saddened by that wholesale marketing obfuscation, obviously engineered to take advantage of Fallout's broader fan base.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @marcuslindley8233
comment: Wow. This guy sucks at reviewing. All he does is just make a big temper tantrum and state that his review was gospel. He made a mistake that every reviewer suffers from: he focuses on what ISNT there. Not on what there IS. What IS there is an environment that's fun to explore, survive in, and maybe do some pvp in. Sure there are tons of glitches, but skyrim had glitches too. LOTS of them. If your main complaint in a game is that it's glitchy, you need to explain how the glitches prevent the game from functioning. The only glitches I encountered were mostly graphical and based on AI, but the game wasn't corrupted beyond repair. It still functions well and is fun to play even without friends. And don't complain that the game feels empty. ITS SUPPOSED TO FEEL EMPTY YOU IDIOT! And look at the bright side, the less NPC's, the less annoying quests! The game still has quests, but they're all optional and are just there if you want some story. The quests are more about the journey than the destination in this game, but you still get rewarded for doing them. Now let's talk about the stash limit: I'm okay with it. I don't have anything against a stash limit. The only reason people are hating on this game is because they're just a bunch of idiots. They don't know how to properly review a game without a bias or explain why the design choices are bad. If you want to say something is bad, give a reason that is not lazy and is in-depth. The best example for a professional reviewer is a youtuber by the name of TGX. His reviews give an in-depth view of games and DESCRIBES their flaws instead of pointing them out. People are saying how bad fallout 76 is but they don't give a reason why. They haven't even PLAYED the game and are just blindly following what some drunk a-hole on the internet is saying. Anyways, enough ranting, my verdict is that the game is good, but is held back by glitches and a weird PVP system. 7/10 or a 6.5/10.
