title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @tyvalentyne
comment: I flat out refuse to purchase The Elder Scrolls 6 based on the utterly flagrant laziness of this game (Fallout 76) from day one to day-"sorry, we can't send you a real canvas bag because even though we charged you over $100 for the collector's edition, we can't be bothered to even send you remorseful letter of apology for failing to meet your expectations by falsely advertising our product." I have been a fan of both the Elder Scrolls and Fallout since at least 2006, but have watched this company and it's games reach unprecedented lows in both aesthetics and story ever since. I had a guttural fear from the first gameplay trailer of 76 that it was Fallout 4 multiplayer mode slightly reskinned and repackaged as a full priced game. No NPCs, GTFO. No optional Co-Op, GTFO. No story. G.T.F.O. Boring crafting system from Fallout 4 repackaged as the MAIN BASE BUILDING MECHANIC. GET THE FUCK OUT. Fuck Todd Howard. Fuck Bethesda. Id Software, we good. But FUCK TODD HOWARD'S BETHESDA.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @KitWriter
comment:
So, I'm thinking that Elder Scrolls online was made to pay for Fallout 4 to be completed (and, eventually, Elder Scrolls no longer required a monthly cost, because FO4 was fully funded).  
Now, the big B duct-taped a Fallout online game to pay for Elder Scrolls 6 to be finished.  So, that's what this game is -- it's paying for Elder Scrolls 6.  
I know it sucks, guys, but you're paying for Elder Scrolls 6 to be funded.  The question is ... are you happy about that?  I'm not.  
Bethesda, put everyone's pay on credit, and pay it off with pre-orders.  Turn a profit on release day.  Pay for DLC with whatever you make after the initial release.  Have some sort of plan, Bethesda.  Don't tape some games together, hype them up, and then give us this hot mess experience that will make us leery about buying your next game. 
Christ. 
Sorry, guys.  Just had to vent, I guess.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @xavariusquest4603
comment:
I know this is late to the race but...I played (and still do) og DOOM, a DOS-based game from 1993.  Cannot compare graphics...but the mechanics of the game were spot on and while hard, at highest level, were achievable because they worked brilliantly.  Fast forward 26 years and I cannot play to FO 76 and I cannot play it because the mechanics are shit.  

My old PC (that I still use to play legacy titles) has 128 megs ram, a 486-66 processor. a 40 Gb HDD, and a 4 Mb VGA video card and the old full implementation of DOS...good for the time but not great.  It plays DOOM better than my current gaming monster plays FO 76.  One reason...the old game was resident the new game is via their servers.  

So we sacrifice gameplay for scenery.  If im forced to choose 1 id rather have wicked game mechanics in a so so enviornment...I can watch a movie later.  

So, I have a monster PC running a game that does not work very well, that requires about 100 Gb of storage, clearly requires more than the min recomm sys req, forces you to be online... (so game play is automatically effected by any connectivity issues), and we've clearly moved the franchise to survival battle royale...with no story reveal other than through horribly depressing tapes, quests that are meaningless, and meatheads flailing about the countryside looking for someone to shoot...something that should make little sense given the story...but is clearly a design expectation given that there is no penalty for killing other survivors.  

GREAT GAME!!!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @khedrak
comment:
PVP in Fallout 76 Is perfect on a PVE server. Now if they would just add a PVP server where everyone is PVP at all times!

Also the go where you want, and do whatever you want is a LIE!
I can not dual-wield melee or ranged weapons (Even though in their video a girl is dual-wielding guns), I can not build a huge base like I can in ARK, I want to repair and drive vehicles but nope NO vehicles, I can not choose the server to join, ¬†no PVP server to chose to join, I can not climb a wall, no zip lines,  no preserving options for my food, I can not store my items in a separate container that is not shared with my stash, I can not move because i'm always over encumbered (Do what I want is loot stuff, I apparently can not do that), ¬†¬†I can not go anywhere for monsters tend to be way too high level and kill me in one hit.


Also some stupid shit like: no hatchet to chopping wood or pickaxes for ore, all we get is our fingers? WTF? They have Axes and pickaxes in the game but you can not use them for gathering materials. Also the log and ore never disappear. They just change how they look. Again WTF!

Water I get radiation if I drink it sure, but why do i get radiation for filling a bottle and then get more if I drink it? I can make stairs but I can not make a ladder?


Fallout 76 is missing so much, has way too many restrictions, has way too many bugs and glitches and one thing it has that it doesn‚Äôt need. CASH SHOP!


Then there is the STUPID Cash Shop! I WILL NOT PLAY a game with a CASH SHOP!


Way more to this but I get pissed just thinking about Fallout 76!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @JarthenGreenmeadow
comment:
I have no idea why they went 0 NPCs. NPCs make games interesting, just look at Black Mountain Radio from Fallout New Vegas you pick it up in certain areas, you get tons of backstory from listening to it and then when you actually get there its a funny pay off that is memorable. Hell even not being able to send Fawkes into the reactor in FO3 was a meaningful interaction, you got to rage because the game was being dumb and excluding an obvious option. Look at the channel Bacon_ on YouTube. His entire channel is just NPCs in Oblivion being hilarious. 

Its just the easiest content to make is an NPC with voice lines that can be repeated out of context for meme purposes. You'd think they'd know that considering Oblivion had "STOP RIGHT THERE CRIMINAL SCUM" and Skyrim with their "Until I took an arrow to the knee"

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @MsCreepyChan
comment:
See, i don't see why people are so mad with Fallout 76. Mainly because, we look at the track record for Bethesda's massive openworld games:
Oblivion (2006):  Upon release, was a buggy piece of shit
Fallout 3 (2008): Upon release, was a buggy piece of shit (Certain versions are still nearly unplayable without fanmade patches)
Skyrim (2011): Upon release, was buggy to the point of unplayable
Elder Scrolls Online (2014): Upon release, was buggy to the point of unplayable
Fallout 4 (2015): Upon release was buggy to the point of unplayable

Why is everyone mad? Why was ANYONE expecting this to be different? Am i literally the only person in the world that saw Fallout 76 and said "I'll give it a year or 2 for them to make it playable, then I may pick it up."

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @KeepWowingMoments
comment: Another negative replied... I can honestly admit the game needs improvement and without argue it lacks story. However, the negative feedback constructed on Youtube from channels is demotivating Bethesda multiplayer experience. It is safe to say, unfortunately, the company will not pursue another multiplayer game in a while and focus on the one player solo series. This is personally affecting me and friends who purchased the game and actual cared to enjoy it. The game is filled with events you can involve yourself and missions which can pass the time. Nevertheless, the best part is the multiplayer. Try to make some friends and do not play by yourself. Socializing is a significant aspect of the game. I can guarantee is better and more enjoyable. Channels in Youtube just focus on hard details based on past games and there experience should not be yours. THIS IS NOT A FALLOUT SERIES CONTINUATION. It is a separate game itself even though it has lores which can enhance the player's fallout story interpretation. For credibility, I have been a successful Youtuber 2 times now both in Anime and Gaming industry. One thing I learned is to never trust what you hear in this platform until you confirmed it for yourself. If you still do not enjoy it after, go enjoy other games such as Red Redemption 2. I am not writing this and spreading this to change youtubers' mind on the game or pursue you to play it because again, that is your choice. The objective is to allow a thought on your minds as that what someone says here or anywhere to not affect your play and enjoyment. Think about it. How many people told you a movie was going to be bad and then when you watched it is a whole different experience. I enjoy the game. Even though I also believe it needs improvements, it has never let me down on my experience nor it has for my friends.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @itsacardboardworldwithshan8603
comment: I have been a Bethesda fan for some time, but that is all over now! I am completely disgusted with this company's turn to "It's About The Money" and not about the people who made them the at one time a "Flagship" AAA game company. Bethesda has now gone the way of EA Games. This bullshit started with Fallout 4 Bethesda doing the same thing other "Low Budget" gaming companies have done? They made their very own Call Of Duty style game. Fallout fans waited close to 9 years for Fallout 4 and we get a half-assed broken piece of shit that was not an RPG but an action shooter with RPG elements flaked in. Then came Fallout 76 a game that has no fucking clue what it wants to be?  These fuckers think us gamers are all a bunch of slack-jawed retards that are fine with whatever they chuck at us and call it a game! WE NEED TO MAKE THEM UNDERSTAND that we are not taking this shit anymore! Start by not buying anything they push no matter how bad you want it, it's only bait hint The ES VI.¬† DON'T BUY IT DON'T FALL FOR THIS BULLSHIT! Did anyone pick up on Tod's "We are fine with the game engine we have" bullshit? They tried making us think that having a completely empty world is a good thing because the players will be occupying it so no need for NPC?????? Are you fucking kidding me? What it does is make for a boring and lifeless¬†void. I will not even get into the bugs that this mess is infested with. Then the complete fuck up with peoples information??? I WOULD FIRE EVERY MOTHERFUCKER INVOLVED! All in all Fallout 76 is a complete Dumpster Fire that needs to be extinguished¬†and buried. Fuck you Tod Howard I'm done with you're fucking snide lying bullshit! You and Pete Hines should go and have a Butfuck session¬†and leave the game making to people who give a fuck! Can I get an amen for Obsidian¬†Entertainment?

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @screenwolf
comment: People don't understand. It's not a hollow shell of a Fallout game lacking a challenge and filled with bugs and design failures, it's just THE GAME IS THE BUGS. People can't say there is no challenge in a game where it's 50/50 if you can complete a quest without the server crashing and you get attacked by invisible creatures that randomly heal every time you shoot them and randomly get stuck in scenery and unable to move. Plus how can people say it's not entertaining when you have a ghoul with no head randomly floating towards you in a T pose. That shit is hilarious. This is a game on a whole new level, the final boss is Bethesda itself. It is sheer genius!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @ferncamper4433
comment:
Thats the reason why I stay away from this game and also told my brother to stay away from it. Most of the reviews I watched on YT shows that this game sux....

And ... The reason why in our days ALL games will be like this is the stupidity of the internet people and brainless fans who always say: they always can fix this things with a patch ... higher bandwith and early access makes people resistant against bad and buggy game designs which on one day will reach a level when there will games be released which wont contain anything until the players tell the developpers what to patch in and how to do it or which is even better and more likely the community will bring out own fixes and patches and mods to compensate the inability of the game developers.

And than you will pay for a "full" game which only contains an editor to Programm mods and other fixes... 

Next point is that they will give you content which is farm 1000000000 this or kill 1000000 this to get the quest done... they will make games so grindy (most fans will call it challenging ) that normal people would think: whoooaaaa... I coming home from 10h work and now I need to cut 1000000 trees to get my house-quest done... yeaaah.... in RL such people would tell you they wont do any work without getting payed for but in games its ok... there its called challenging or fun...

And as long there are people who accept this strategies of the game companies and do not do anything against it and buying thier fully priced early access games and (most of them) do not say anything against it the companies will go on with that and will make it more and more worse...

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Vodkamester
comment:
Guys... Maybe some of you remember the Mass effect exactly the last "mass effect"  Well Fallout 76 Practically the same result.
Buggy, Non existant or lame story, and overall boring gameplay... but boring as fuck...

Both fall in the same pit from same god damn reason: Greed

The Fallout shoud have remain what they are good... (excuse me)The BEST!    
Singleplayer, not but almost impeccable quality of gameplay, not by the Ai... the ai was never too smart in the bethesda game... But a the vast of options, options the gamers can affect the world, not respectively, but your all the time your actions have a consequence. Like far harbor Actually i was take negative teh first time when the charma system was cuted out from the F4 but later i realised, it's have a good purpose: Thinking out of the box, you can decide whic is good, bad or wrong.
But msot of it all they creat a massive sandbox area which have the basic pillar of gameplay, so you can play without bore yourself to death, but if you want more actions and content do your self, by FREE mods.

By the way i was Wrote off the Fallout 76 the very same moment when they said "i'ts Multiplayer"
Don't misunderstand me:  They have not he experiance and kind a community wich are prefer a Coop Multipalyer. Especially in a survival game where blood and gore is every minute item... They have the experience to creat this as a Singleplayer and a Supporting commmunity to take it gladly, but not in multiplayer.
Offcourse the last part maybe jsut my opinion and my opinion alone, but i think they the multi is the reason why they fucked up so bad...

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @123sleepygamer
comment: Survival is good when the GAME is good. Look at Subnautica (I know the console release is terrible, it's very irritating) that game is old as hell but experiencing games like that for the first time is amazing. Bethesda should have looked at what made survival and exploration fun in Subnautica and try to carry over those qualities in their own game, if they want to make a survival game, look at what people did right in the genre and go from there. NOT this mess. Even without server issues or bugs the game isn't fun or interesting or creepy or ANYTHING that a survival game needs to be a good seller. As stated, look at The Forest or Subnautica or if you want to go online, ARK or Rust.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @marioantonio321
comment:
Bathesda's concepts are so supreme yet over hyped, the players just end up forgiving them for their poor execution and outdated (ugly character designs, clunky animations, buggy programming, etc.) game development. All their releases have always been more infested with bugs than the entire Fallout Wasteland they're trying to depict. They are the CTD and Glitch Kings yet also the most successful developers that a lot of people in the gaming industry -- including gamers and reviewers -- are more than willing to give an easy pass to just because their concepts and ideas are always top. Their final products though, quite franky... ultimately SUCK more than all the good things you can squeeze out of them. It's just a technical fuckfest of an ordeal players have to go through just to finish their games. It's the MODDING COMMUNITY that give their products such longevity and playability and that's where they can be given legit praise and credit in how easy it is to mess around with their primitive code. Otherwise they're overrated to the level of the Nine Divines just like Todd Howard is. Maybe it's time for them to look at using other much superior game engines out there. 

Their in-house programming is a whole lump of SHIT. Probably overpaid SHIT.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @danielprudhoe647
comment:
Games/Developers/Publishers I've boycotted (and believe others should do too for the sake of the future of gaming):

EA (microtransactions and DLC is ridculous, fucked over plenty of games as of late like SW: Battlefront, ME: Andromeda, NFS, SimCity etc)
Konami (MGSV being unfinished, and their treatment of staff such as Hideo Kojima)
Sega (never again buying a TW game after the last few I played (latest being Warhammer 1), and also responsible for allowing Alien: CM to be released in the state it was in)

Semi-Boycott (Just because I reallllyyyy like some of their games so can't bring myself to boycott them completely):

Activision (Only play Destiny 2....but I still think they're dicks for allll the expansions/annual pass/microtransactions)
Ubisoft (similar to EA, also look at WatchDogs 1, several AC games, For Honor and more for disastrous games with lots of promise.....RBS: Siege is good though, and the last 2 AC games have been decent compared to some of the shittier titles they released like Unity)
Capcom (Only like the RE series, but again, their DLC practices and the way they treat consumers sucks)
Gearbox (I like Borderlands. But they completely fucked over Alien: CM and Duke Nukem Forever and didn't give a flying fuck about it)

Bethesda are in the last chance saloon with me with this whole Fallout 76 debacle. I think regardless how their next game(s) turn out, I will be getting ESVI regardless, just because of how big of a fan I am of that series. But if they somehow manage to make that game bad.....it will be the last time I ever buy anything from them. Honestly a bit worried that they might do something that will completely ruin the game though

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @darrylferguson3622
comment:
All they had to do was delay the game and people would understand, because we ad seen what a mess the Beta was. In hindsight, Bethesda has not fixed the bugs in Skyrim even after 7 years, so expecting them to fix it in 2 weeks was expecting too much. 

The part that pisses me off is the lies and the lack of effort put into it- it basically used the same engine as FO4, half of the assets were from FO4 and the same bugs that modders fixed in FO4 appeared again.

If this was a FO4 mod for $20, i would not buy it and wait for a mod version because at least they would care to make it interesting.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @tomgardner9069
comment:
*EXTREME GOLF CLAP FOR ANGRY JOE*  Honestly, my first connection to the Fallout franchise was Fallout 4.  I had heard the hype about the Fallout series and finally took the plunge because my girlfriend wanted it as well and bought Fallout 4.  Honestly, I was not impressed.  In fact, I was bored as shit.  I saw too many damned glitches and wondered what the fuck was the big deal about Fallout and Bethesda.  To be quite frankly honest with you, you might have just let EA Games get into the cookie jar on this one.  When it came time for Fallout 76, I asked my girlfriend if she wanted it because I didn't.  Her response was basically, "Fuck no."  Looking back, the graphics for Fallout 76 don't look any better than those in Fallout 4.  I wasn't impressed with those graphics, either.  

If I want a post-apocalyptic game, I'll stick with The Last of Us.  Naughty Dog at least gives a shit about their players.  Hell, the Mad Max game that came out a few years ago was a lot more fun and less glitchy than what I've seen from Bethesda's Fallout recently.  

What these game publishers need to understand is that it's better to do a lot of beta testing with the public, particularly on the open-world games that have so many variables where things can go wrong.  

On the buyers' side of things (yes, you, the Dorito and Mt. Dew crowd), quit pre-ordering....particularly from the publishers/devs who have a history of releasing half-baked/unfinished games for full AAA developer prices.  (Assassin's Creed:  Unity, anyone?)  

You're basically feeding the beast.  The more you buy from them, the more they're going to think that it's okay to keep doing this and keep releasing broken and unfinished pieces of shit to the market.  

Think of it this way:  if you go to a restaurant and get shitty service from the waiter/waitress (your drink isn't filled, nobody goes around and checks on you, your order is wrong, food's cold, etc)....do you tip them?  Do you go back to have the same thing happen to you?  Do you pay two months in advance for your shitty service/meal?  YOU GO SOMEWHERE ELSE...if you've got a brain in your head.

Sorry if this seems like I'm being an asshole, but I was in professional sales and saw a lot of shady shit done by sales personnel.  They basically lie to you about what to expect and give you the idea that whatever you're buying is life-changing...and then you wind up with an Ikea furniture kit missing half the pieces with instructions in an obscure dialect of Swedish that even Google Translate can't read.

What's going to happen is the video game industry is going to continue putting out half-baked shit as long as people are buying it.  Please refer to the Atari 2600 E.T. game, which was one of the most anticipated games at the time.  It ended up being one of the worst games--absolutely unplayable, and Atari almost lost their shirt over it.  The majority of their E.T. game cartridges ended up in a landfill.  If it hadn't been for Nintendo, home video gaming would have died out.  You don't believe me about video games in this day and age dying out?  History repeats itself.  

The only way that the gaming community is going to see reform is to quit pre-ordering.  Demand alpha-testing and beta-testing; hell, post-beta-testing if you can get it.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @SatoshiKong
comment:
For anyone still defending Bethesda or F76, consider the following:

A reputable car dealership sells you a newer model of the car you used to drive at full price. You inquire about the technical aspects of the car, but all they can tell you is that "it just works." This rubs you the wrong way, but you're willing to overlook it because you've been buying from them for years and feel that they've earned your trust. On the way home, you discover a minor flaw with the steering wheel, but you shrug it off because you manage to find a way to work around it. Over the next couple of days, what you initially thought was one minor flaw reveals itself to actually be dozens of minor flaws that affect multiple parts of the car. So many minor flaws, in fact, that they all add up and become a major flaw that renders the car all but useless. You confront the dealership about it, hoping for the refund you clearly deserve, but the only thing they offer you is an air freshener and a bobblehead toy to put on your dashboard, along with a vague promise of "fixing it" in the indefinite future, as long as you're willing to identify the flaws yourself as they keep happening and report them accordingly because they themselves aren't even aware of how many flaws actually exist.

Would you be okay with that?

author: @aaronhammond7315
comment: lol hes really angry in this one, good way to get the point across joe, no really, lol the game is absolute garbage, wouldn't even let my dog eat it, extremely disappointing for AAA title, you think if they had half a brain they would of looked at "No Mans lie's" fuck up and learnt to not go down that path, but no they didn't, have lost massive respect for this development and they will have to not just win me back over with something out this world amazing but millions of others to. P.S to past,present and future devs, (1). stop the bullshitting and over hypeness of introducing games at events and advertised trailers, unless your 99.9% positive and confident you/s think your game is going to be that good (common sense!!). (2). listen to your fan base (NO MATTER WHAT YOU OR YOUR DEV TEAM THINKS OR SAYS)because we are the target consumer/Audience, not you devs, we are the ones you are trying to impress (OBVIOUSLY :/), (3). Be light on microtransactions or better yet go back to old school roots and cut them out completely, or with microtransactions, again (LISTEN TO YOUR FAN BASE FOR  CONSTRUCTIVE IDEAS AS TO WHAT "WE" WANT AS MICROTRANSACTIONS "NOT JUST YOUR STUDIOS/TEAM IDEAS")because we being your audience have some really good ideas and they just get brushed under the carpet, and those really great          Ideas could potentially earn you a better reputation for the company as well as revenue and your fan base, (BE MORE OPEN TO IDEAS AND SUGGESTIONS FROM ANYONE AS A WHOLE NOT JUST ON YOURS OR THE TEAMS TERMS PLZ!!). (4). Try to give your Dev Team/s, studio/s enough time to work on the game and if you cannot by any circumstance reach the deadline of release for a almost 100% functional game (DO NOT RELEASE IT PERIOD, NO MATTER IF ITS CHRISTMAS, EASTER AND BLAH BLAH BLAH, OTHER HOLIDAY SEASONS). (4). Before release (TEST! TEST! TEST! AND MORE TESTING! OF YOUR SELLING YOUR PRODUCT TO THE CONSUMER/AUDIENCE) you can't go wrong if your game functions and plays nicely from point A to point Z, and yes new bugs will arise from your fanbase/s, as well as your dev team may discover (OBVIOUSLY :/), but please in future iron out the most damaging, annoying and frustrating Major bugs first and then focus on the minors bugs the least or some what lastly, depending on what it is that could potentially turn into a bigger problem. Ok so that about wraps it up with my rant to any devs or wanna be devs out there, I shouldn't have to be writting a long ass comment about what a Lead Dev and his team/s should be doing to impress his consumers and fanbase, this should be on point all the time and every time, but I'm just one guy, like the rest of everyone globally with all different views and opinions. So happy gaming to everyone and let us rise up to these gaming developers and maybe with enough force from us players, we will have a big enough back bone to drive them to the point of listening to our forgotten words and wisdom, to create a better gaming world and experience for future generations to come. Sorry again for the long tedious comment, felt it had to be said and thankyou for reading :).

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @dragonoverlord2010
comment:
Ya know, I just LOVE being the most sensible person in the room.  No really, I do.  I get to sit here in my throne of golden obviousness reminding you all that "I told you so".  I said the whole time that paid mods on consoles was the beginning of the end for Bethesda.  Oh it was a good run alright, but then we let them start charging us for something we used to do for free, and now continue to do so.  We told them: "we want more meaningless bullshit we are more than willing to pay for".  Well, I mean, YOU told them that, not me.  I was never stupid enough to fall for that scam.  They think all we want are big open worlds with a pretty sandbox and horizon, and stuff to buy, and lo and fucking behold: that's what they gave you.

What's worse is you let them put it on consoles only.  CONSOLES!  Don't get me wrong, I still have a console myself what I use regularly, BUT this was obviously a means to control the modding community as a means of easy income.  Bethesda knows that the independent modders are the lifeblood of their games on PC, which is why they brought them to console and forced us to pay for them in the first place.  You may have joked about it, but at the end of the day there was no real outcry.  No backlash.  Everyone just kinda said, "Eh, whatcha gonna do?", and that was a green light to keep doing it.  You laid back and took that abuse, and now it's all you get.

I told you so, but think of this as an opportunity.  Now you can see the lines that lead to these money grubbing schemes, and now you can stamp your foot down and say, "No.  I will not buy a multiplayer-only game from a company that is becoming increasingly infamous for it's bugged out, broken games, some of which STILL aren't entirely patched."  And before a single one of you says "It's not multiplayer-only; you don't HAVE to play with other people if you don't want to", yes it is, shut up, you're wrong.  You need a constant internet connection to play, which makes it online only.  Say "enough is enough".  Multiplayer doesn't make a series better.  Is Elder Scrolls Online the definite installment of that franchise?  HELL NO!  Skyrim is, and everyone knows it!  And at least that had other people besides horrible, terrible *real* people to talk to, so you knew you actually were in another world that had stuff happening in it.

PEOPLE!  Wake up!  You let this happen to EA.  You let this happen to Ubisoft.  Are you going to let it happen with Bethesda?  What's next, Nintendo?  Are we going to tell the game world's happy little actually-invested-in-beta-testing-to-a-mirror-polished-finish cherub, Nintendo, that it's okay to start with a slightly okay "thing" they stapled together out of scraps then and then charge us for "more please" and proceed to shovel bullshit into our waiting maws like good little baby birds, until the "more please" bullshit is all we're starting with???  Well I certainly didn't start saying that was okay, and I invite you to join me in saying just the opposite.

"I won't stand for this shit, and neither should you."

PS  Guys, stop pre-ordering games.  That's 90% of the problem.  When you pay for something before it's even made what obligation do they have to put any effort into it at all?  "$200", they're not even finished, and now you get a hunk of plastic with a lightbulb in it you could have gotten as a Halloween mask, which will now sit on your shelf for the next three months before disappearing into the closet, and inevitably your storage unit.  You're basically talking to a door to door salesman offering you a great deal on this encyclopedia set.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Ranylyn
comment:
I don't want to sound like some kind of console elitist; I play on both console and PC, and both platforms have their merits. But I do blame a very specific portion of the PC playerbase for the hubris Bethesda had when thinking this was a good idea. If this doesn't sound like you, then I'm not talking about you, and don't get all "bawww don't generalize us, we're not all like that" because I know; I'm talking about a very specific subset of PC players in this post and as someone who also plays PC sometimes (Morrowind and Fallout 3 were on Console, Oblivion and Skyrim were PC, and I haven't had the time or money to play the rest) I'd have to be an idiot to think all PC players are like what I'm about to describe; I know only some are.

In recent years - specifically the last two years since I actually was without a decent PC for gaming from 2011-2016 due to hardware issues - I've noticed a very vocal subset of players around games that have modding scenes. "A negative review because the game doesn't even load? How fucking DARE you not expect to fix it yourself, you pussy consolefag plague on the industry! Stop ruining real games with your bitching and go choke on your mobile games!" Whether it's the frankly unacceptable PC port of Jade Empire (it needs fan patches to even be playable in the second town of the game since the framerate drops to 1 since the engine itself craps out, even on a beastly rig that Jade Empire uses only 1% of the resources of) or a Bethesda game, there's a VERY noisy group out there that thinks the devs don't need to release a functional game; these people expect it to be on the average user to do it themselves.

You may wonder why I blame this specific subset, when surely a small raging group wouldn't be worth Bethesda's time? Well, imagine a substitute teacher in a classroom where two children are throwing tantrums. Even if the other 28 are complete angels, negative emotions have a stronger impact than positive ones, and those two problem students will be the ones that teacher remembers. Who's Bethesda more likely to really notice? The fans who are like "We like your games and all, but you need to fix them" or the rage-a-holics who go to war with anyone who thinks Bethesda needs to anything? The shrieks of one side overwhelm the reason of the other, despite the smaller numbers. Bethesda releases buggy messes because they don't think it matters due to fans fixing it for them, and current gen consoles having access to limited modding only makes it more apparent how lazy they're getting.

So in closing, remember this: You can mod the worst game in the world until it's the best game in the world, but it won't mean the original devs made anything good. Hold devs to a higher standard than "fix it yourself, shitheads, we can't be bothered," ESPECIALLY in an online game where modding is either denied/restricted or can cause issues when one player loads in with gear no one else's computer knows how to interpret. If you keep defending companies like Bethesda, they'll release something the players CAN'T fix - like Fallout 76 - and you can see how that's going!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @MexicanSpeedster
comment: Ok, Joe hear me out here, I think Todd Howard did this shit on purpose. Not out of greed but planning. I know its hard to believe but even Todd has a boss. They don't want to dish out millions to make a new engine. Todd Howards ambitious projects need a new engine and a larger team. He goes to his bosses and deny his requests for a larger team and new engine. The way they think is "Since people will buy anything Bethesda makes why make a new engine. Don't fix what ain't broke." So he introduces the idea of a Fallout Multiplayer game. The executives are practically drooling over the potential sales of an Online Fallout game they can just ravage. So they put together what we have now Fallout 76. Now Todd has his bigger team for his later projects. Now here's where the genius comes in. I think he knew that the game engine couldn't handle it. I think he knew the game would be a glitchy mess and that people would be up in arms about it. I think he planned this so that he could get the greenlight for Bethesda to start work on a new engine. If this theory is correct it explains a lot. I think Todd is sitting back and laughing as Bethesda is burning so he can rebuild it.

As a survival game, it is very appealing and the game is really fun to play with a friend. This game should not be run through in fast pase, this is a role playing game. Dont run around like chikens whitout any purpuse or imaginations. Fallout is for those whit great or little fantasy and imagination, combined whit game lore and whit tons of side mission you have a complete game full of  bugs butt the will fix that. Fallout fans will not abandon this, rather they will be a part of the game development during time to come and soon we have whole Nort America to explore together.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @manbearpiglett-4110
comment:
Look....look. Ya'll are just salty because it's taken you THIS long since Skyrim, to realise Bethesda make excellent video game EXPERIENCES. Not excellent video games.

You walk out on a perfect sunrise in the forests of Skyrim and the light flickers through the trees and the little stream bubbling in the background, or you gaze out over the beautiful panoramic display of the ruined wastelands, and think wistfully of the ruination of man.

Then what? Janky, bugged out mechanics, boring and formulaic dialogue, a gigantic worklist of quests, and zero intensity. Zero. Save every few minutes, death is meaningless, and your main quest's importance is ruined by the constant side quests so it just feels meaningless.

I'm pro-sandbox, but Bethesda just make directionless messes that bamboozle everyone with insanely good visuals. I've enjoyed my time in Fallout 3, 4 and Skyrim. I don't feel the need to return any time soon.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @OpenMawProductions
comment:
Wow. This game really is a shit show.

I haven't really stuck with the series since Fallout 3. I just didn't like the direction I could see it going. The classic Fallout games are where it's at, and unfortunately I think the brand has now been permanently damaged. It's going to take a firm and careful hand, and really clear direction, with the next Fallout game to really fix this. 

And ya know, that ending bit with micro-transactions... We gotta drop the "micro" part, honestly. When you spend 18 bucks on a paint scheme or five bucks on a hair style... That's not micro. You buy full fledged indie-games on STEAM for that price on a regular day. 

I think it would be totally fine for developers to offer custom skins or hair pieces for pennies on the dollar. A quarter. Something. But you should not be paying the cost of a full indie or budget game for a piece of fucking cosmetics...

And that's only the side, of course. With all these bugs and glitches, and obvious indications that things were not tested properly before release... Just save your money.

comment:
Thank god my friend told me to wait on buying this... he used fallout 4 and EOS as an example of how they don‚Äôt listen to the players requests. 

We asked for fallout with friends. They gave us fallout 4. 

We asked for fallout with friends, AGAIN. They gave us a mmo. 

We asked for elder scrolls with friends. They gave us a mmo while The gaming community gave us like 12 versions of co-op. 

Bethesda is steadily going down the EA route and idk if I trust them to ever put money up early for a game again (Especially since we don‚Äôt have to anymore as we can digitally download the game and not have to stand outside GameStop overnight anymore).

Elder scrolls 6 is the last game I‚Äôll give a serious look at, but if they mess that up as well I‚Äôm going to the stock market and bidding on their stock failing. ProjektRed might be the new wave for me.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @misguidedterror8397
comment:
They want to minimize cost while maxing profit which isn‚Äôt a bad thing. It‚Äôs becomes bad when it takes away from the customers. So they spent so little on the game and so little on the bag while overhyping the game (because thats free, the players do that most) and making it look good in advertising so people think it looks cool and buy a shit ton of copies. I don‚Äôt trust any game developer now because this is how it is now, the days of passionate people making a game for the sake of quality is over. Now it‚Äôs the corporate machine that took over, it can work sometimes because that provides more resources to make a higher quality game but it will always lead to shit like this where corporate says ‚Äúyeah that sounds cool but what about the costs? Can you make XYZ cost less so we make more profit??? Thanks pumpkin I knew you would understand.‚Äù Throwing games out like Scalebound which looked amazing to me and it could‚Äôve been such a good game. But no they want to make the same damn thing over again.

Notice how every single game that comes out looks like a movie trailer?? Yeah it‚Äôs becoming the movie business now, copy and paste things that work and make money and killing things that is innovative, imaginative, new, and unique because it‚Äôs too risky and too costly, Star Wars anyone?? Halo anyone?? Destiny anyone?? Gears of war anyone? COD anyone?? Come on might as well do it. its gonna come out no matter what because they‚Äôre making money off it. Eventually that‚Äôs all we‚Äôre gonna have in the gaming industry copy and pasted games.

Anyway, I haven't played fallout 76 yet, but I'm thinking that I won't do it. I haven't seen a positive review of it, and I watched a lot. For what I know, I think it can be fixed... With a lot work, but it's possible.
I think the only way to do a good multi-player shooter is copying Borderlands, it has a ton of side quests, a good story, and coop. Yes it's a linear story and decisions have no impact on the story, but even that can be done with some creativity... And no, I don't think a fallout should be like that, but I think it can take some things from it.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Rattattattatt
comment:
Remember in fallout 4 that the NPCs and story was so bad, you wished they made 76? 
Remember in Fallout3, NV, and 4 clicking the VATS button and the game crashing? Ah nostalgia. I miss losing 30+ minutes of gaming because I didn't find a bed to save, losing my drops, and having to replay content I just did. 
Those games are still in that state. It's 2018 and they still freeze and break. It's funny because it's a single player game. I have been DCed less than I have in any other fallout game and I'm level 90 - and it's a multiplayer world. I think they're doing just fine.
People like to be romantics and act like their memory isn't flawed. Look up the study with the lady who was cognizant while being raped, and how she "knew" who raped her and wrongfully accused the same guy twice. So much for photographic memory huh?
The more people rip on 76, like this one "OMG THEY TOOK FALLOUT 4 AND REMOVED ALL THE STORY FOR FETCH QUESTS: the more I look back at the older ones and I think: "a settlement needs your help"; "I need you to receive this beacon" "Go to the dead drop" - LOL. NO SERIOUSLY GUYS THERE IS A FUCKING SETTLEMENT THAT NEEDS YOUR HELP! THIS IS THE BEST GAME EVER! Fallout 4 had terrible NPCs, story, and was nothing but fetch quests. They dumbed down the system and perk cards are WAY more flexible. I can stack dromedary and cola nut so that 1 nuka cola hydrates me. I'm having fun. I'm sure other people are having fun whining and selectively remembering.

Fallout 76 is RICH in potential!  i feel i just about got my moneys worth ofcourse they could have done better... however i would be willing to pay for DLCs, i hope they add further end game content, idealy games like these shouldent have a end game....
also looking forward to the private servers so we can have actuall modded games
what im worried about here is the irrational complaints about Fallout 76, people treat this is how Fallout games will be, like its fallout 5. but its not! its a multiplayer game spin off! should be gratefull they did this and have many plans for future expansions.
but i will be pissed off if bethesda pulls the plug on it like EA did to mass effect andromeda and we just get stuck with a base game and little late game content!!!!!

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @quantumitalian9419
comment: You know, I've played a lot of Fallout 76.  My friend bought it for me because he wanted friends to play with and he is a die hard Fallout fan.  He also pre-ordered the power armor edition.  He has, and is, trying really hard to like this game, so am I, but its just a mess.  The lack of NPCs, the stale main quest, and the worst part is being unable to interact with the quest objectives.  Bethesda was my second favorite developer after Bungie, but we all know what happened to them.  Then Bethesda did one of the owrst things which is add micro-transactions, and I'm willing to bet they are working on DLC at the same time they are trying to fix bugs and patch in assests for said DLC, which is why the patches seem to do nothing.  If they release DLC before fixing most of this game, I will not play any of their new releases until its been thoroughly reviewed.  I agree with you Joe, this is nonsense, and Bethesda can and should have done much better with what they've got.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @marisakai3283
comment: An optimistic theory: In order for them to make the next upcoming games even better, a quick cash grab was necessary for possibly many reasons. Budget, salary, debt, etc.. Giving them the benefit of the doubt that this was their first try at an online fallout. They failed to finish by their deadline, and needed more capital to continue working on it. A lie for the future. The big picture. But, that's just a theory. Maybe they betrayed themselves. Either way, shame on you, bethesda. You get one free pass though. Just one. I'd expect this from other companies, but you. You're better than this.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @TaddiestMason
comment: Welcome to the truth. What I‚Äôve been saying for years is finally becoming apparent to everyone else: the AAA gaming industry is releasing unfinished games you‚Äôre paying them to essentially beta test. You‚Äôre being sold early access games in reverse without being told. With regular early access games, you know it‚Äôs early access and you save money as the game is cheaper at that point and you get future content updates for free. With AAA gaming, you pay MORE for the early access AND you pay for the future content as they finish the game. You‚Äôre being scammed and you‚Äôre paying for the pleasure. Wake up, everybody.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @stivestivesy3517
comment:
Fellow Bethesda fanboy here who is still enjoying the game at (my slow pace) level 25. I've waited a little over a week now to watch your review to gain some more perspective first. This is one of my favorite reviews you've ever done. I agree with just about all of what you said, and I sincerely wish Bethesda would have delayed this game, or done a much, MUCH longer beta. I hope videos like yours, and all the backlash over this release, serve to ensure we don't have future releases like this from them. We all know they can do so much better.

That said, my justification for still enjoying FO76 would be the map. That "rich kid's fancy sandbox full of shitty/broken toys" goes a long way for some of us. No other open world game designs a map quite like a BGS game. It's the sheer quantity of unique locations, even the unmarked ones with shitty loot, each one seems to have some thought put into it (some just have silly/cool/interesting things to look at). I always notice the shortcuts other developers take to fill their worlds up, whether it be an over-reliance on prefabs, or an algorithm designed to randomly generate unique locations for them, it never feels quite as good to explore. Bethesda seems like they painstakingly design vast amounts of their maps with so much detail that you could spend dozens of hours on exploration alone.

Another way to describe FO76 for me would be like... a drawing made by a two-year-old, that a master artist then picks up and spends 40 hours coloring, texturing, and detailing. Yea the shape of the initial drawing would still look crude and messed up, but damn if there wouldn't still be a lot of cool shit to look at in the finer details. There's no excuse for the state this game is in, but I think even just having a BGS-designed map to explore makes it worth playing (though arguably not at $60).

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @natebardwell
comment: Here's where we failed Bethesda; we as their community have been unfucking their games since the beginning, hotfixing and updating and patching it for them. They've always had frankly shitty developers, and outstanding content creators. Then they removed the only reason people play Bethesda games in the first place, the NPC and stories surrounding these tangible things, and the only thing left was the black sheep dev team. They actually built an entire MMO featuring all of their weakness and little to none of their strengths. They were never a company capable of this, and any of us who've spent a long enough time playing their games should have known better. Where they failed was from its inception, and what they should be most ashamed of, is that they absolutely knew better as well but still went for the cash grab.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Praxics0815
comment:
Bethesda is always like this. I'm sorry but the writing was on the wall.
Heck even Sykrim or Fallout 4 are actually a mess and they never fixed the bugs. For crying out loud some of the bugs in the engine are from 2006 and not fixed. 
Guys‚Ä¶ get real. Todd Howard literally said on the press conference that the made the same game over and over. And people still buy it, a lot.
There is even some good in there at least for Skyrim and Fallout 4: Mods.
But honestly having the community fix your ass broken game is a poor buisness model, at least for the consumer. Yet for some reason people let it pass‚Ä¶ well you asked to be screwed doing that.

I blame Bethesda policy of keeping that GameBryo engine alive. Todd may claim that the ‚Äúchanged every module and its a brand new engine‚Äù but I call bullshit on his crap, he is just full of shit these days.
Its a rotten foundation, completely outdated and riddled with issues the haven‚Äôt fixed for around 15 years. Don‚Äôt expect them to fix them now...
They need something completely different, something new but it won‚Äôt happen. Why? Money.
Their staff knows their way around the established tools and they can therefore crank out new instalments with relative ease. They will be buggy messes but that hasn‚Äôt bothered the community before‚Ä¶ again: You asked to be screwed at some point.

The joke is they actually have idTech‚Ä¶

 Starfield and Elder Scroll 6 will use GameBryo again and the muppets will buy it again.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @yosoy1loco
comment:
I understand most of his critique points, and even without playing it, i do not doubt that it is a shit game. But two things bother me about his analysis:

1) Perksystem without respec - yeah, sounds like Joe has not paid much attentiont to most of the games in the fallout series- It has always been that way. it is supposed to be thought through before, building a character, same like Diablo2. Oh you're casual? Fuck it - that is really not hard to do and "casualization" is actually fucking up the pc gaming scene for years, together with consolegaming and politicial correctness.
2) colorful world - Fallout is supposed to be grey, brown and dark. It is a nuclear Wasteland, not fucking Azeroth. 

People are angry about that game? Completely undestandable, but why are people so surprised. It was steadily declining hard with Fo4. 
The old Fallout games were really geniune for their time.
Fallout3 was a surprisingly good adaption to firstperson.
Vegas was absolutely cool, and it was punishing in comparison to FO3.


For me and many others Fallout was in essence an exploring and survival game, with a dark and nostalgic athmosphere, which got lighten up by edgy humor. The gameplay mechanics were always a bit over "casual" level, at least in the old ones, and that was a good thing. A game from this series should always contain those aspects, even if you develope it as an MMO-clone. That means:

- AfterWar Athmosphere and Nostalgia
- Well written NPCs, that introduce you into the world and its rules, cause players cant give you that kind of a story, especially if you target a fucking fornite-kid audience
- Society in which you need to integrate, otherwise face consequences
- No Equipment-Restriction, you use what you can find and loot 
-  Punishing Encounters, especially if there are other real people around
- character planing and different playstyle to fight through the world and aquire goods
- No Bulletsponging, it is about killing, not "knocking" off Hitpoints, Encounters should always feel dangerous 
- Decisionmaking, beeing able to make changes to the world or NPCs, but also beeing able to loose stuff, getting Injuries, facing consequences of your choices

Most of those aspects were already not established in the least in FO4.
When they announced Fo76 I already knew the series is dead.

Your job is to release a finish ga... have you played Fallout 4 that requires a massive USER MADE patch to fix the bugs they left behind?

However, Fallout 76 was fun, I got 50 hours into it with a viewer friend at least and I enjoyed every minute of it, because it was more of what I loved in Fallout 4... the combat.

Fallout 4 was a failure of a Fallout game, but at least the combat and customization was top notch and that's just more of what 76 brings to the table.

All the glitches and everything was cute at first. They were funny to see. But they dont because "LOL The fanbase will probably love it just leave it". Its completely unprofessional. I can only imagine how terribly they treat the employees there. They probably stress them out and rush them so hard nothing turns out right. So you have a group of employees who have lost their shit and have thrown something together in a panic and hope it's good enough for them to keep their jobs. I don't understand why these big game companies need deadlines.


And this really makes me really worried for ES6. I've been so excited for it, and i know they probably aren't even working on it yet. But the thing is they don't want to change anything. They don't want to switch to a new game engine at all. They'll just keep using the creation engine because "its gotten better." Honestly, no it hasn't. I'm worried that ES6 is just gonna be a carbon copy of skyrim. Same quality and all.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @brionicgaming
comment: I mean Fallout died in FO4 IMO so I'm still not sure why anyone is surprised or reacting this way. I would consider myself a true Fallout fan, when Bethesda took over I was nervous but fairly satisfied with FO3. Then Obsidian came a long with NV and crushed it, great FO game. FO4 however showed the direction the franchise was going, a limited story on rails that was only enjoyable when I modded it to be enjoyable. They took all the effort out of developing multiple story paths where your paths had paths within paths and simplified their programing, Tod Howard straight up confirmed that. Ultimately I think the hate train on 76 is dumb because sadly there are people out there enjoying the game, but they aren't true Fallout fans. As for all the people constantly bitching about this game, where were you when FO4 launched. Would much rather have heard complaints then...

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Vestner262
comment:
The problem starts at the consumer. You people continue to shell out huge amounts of money for collectors editions, pre-orders and other bogus shit from gaming companies that are scummy and treat YOU, the consumer, like wallets. You get all hyped up and excited from these multi million dollar trailers they release; cause THEY know the "TAKE MY MONEY" morons like AngryJoe are gonna dish out hundreds of dollars for this garbage. You know why? Cause you KEEP falling for the same shit over and over again. They could release Fallout 77, Q1 of next year, and you "Take my Money" shills would be salivating over the trailers and garbage PR.

STOP buying from these companies. I haven't bought an EA game since Battlefield 2. I got a bad taste in my mouth from Battlefield 2142 demo, and they've released nothing but junk year after year. Start supporting companies that make good games. Stop wasting money on pre-orders and SE's, do your due diligence and wait for reviews from reputable sources; not from companies being paid by the publishers. Stop being mindless zombie fanboys for your beloved franchise that these suit wearing mfers are destroying by taking advantage of your fandom. MAKE them release quality games. The only way to do that is to close your wallet and stop supporting these publishers.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @romaosoares5195
comment: Have you no shame in being an adult brat? Look, the game has many flaws. I agree. But there are a lot of qualities if you stop being a spoiled child for a minute and observe the details in the game. How can you be so blind as to call the game ugly? It's beautiful, specially for an on-line game. Oh... So there is light coming out from a spot a little lower than it was supposed to? Oh, my God! Call the Pentagon. The game has a lot of bugs, wich I hope will be fixed, and has terrible players, like no doubt yourself, but there is so much to enjoy, and every angry nerd only seem to take joy in calling it trash. I wander trough an empty desolated world with a close friend by my side, and together we learn a little bit about those who where faced with the desolation of the atomic war step by step as we stop to notice details in the homes and buildings, and stop to listen and discuss a holotape we found near a corpse. After clearing a train junkyard, me and my pal stop to drink a nuka cola and take a picture from the highest point in the area, and that picture turns into my loading screen so I can remember my journey so far. Yesterday a listened to a tape of a woman who hid from the scorched in a closet, and got stuck there. I heard her journal as she slowly lost hope and the last of her energy, until she finnally was reduced to try and move her toes. I was touched by the suffering she endured, and I really felt like a survivor in land of pain. If you can't enjoy any of that, than I'm afraid your inner child has died, and I honestly don't know why are you playing games. To collect points? To check where every beam of light is comming from? Maybe just to make money from being a completely disqualified critic on the internet for children to stupdly admire.

I was excited about this game - I've got maybe 20 hours in it.. bored to tears. $60... for what I feared was gonna be a Fallout 4 multiplayer asset flip as you said.. and thats exactly what it was. When I was younger I shoplifted the game because I loved the demo and I didn't have money. Later on I went out and paid for it, and I've bought it multiple times since then. I'm not a fanboy, but I've been a dedicated fan for nearly 20 years.

If I knew about Fallout 76 now, saw it on the ground when I was 16... I'd probably pick it up, but not bother to play it. Bethesda has been grabassing off the universe since Fallout 3 and has added absolutely nothing to the universe since they got it. Mutants, ghouls, awesome. What have they added since? Cazadore? Oh wait no, that was Black Isle...

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @gregbooth4841
comment:
Bethesda, Bethesda Never Changes - The end of the franchise came pretty much as we expected, too many bugs and not enough QA to go around.  Ignore the trolls Joe, youve been honest, thats all that matters.  Did you hear Ron Perlman is getting surgery to change his voice so no one associates him with Fallout anymore.

I ignored all the hate pre release to decide for myself about F76.  Even got PA Edition.  But the proof is in the Perfectly Preserved Pie.  65% of enemy corpses despawn before a ranged stealth player gets the loot theyve earned.  Major waste of time and bullets.  Animals vanish that you hunt without you getting the meat for your hunger.

At first I thought Whitespring was haunted, robots crawling on their chests, objects flying about crazy like.  A Poltergeist?  Nope just your typical Todd Howard Soup of the Day.  PvP'ers with all the Enclave stuff claiming sections of Whitespring and ganking people four on 1 if you dare try to kill a Ghoul in "their" farming spot.  So much for a little drama.  Its leave or run out of stims from these gank squads.

My modest house vanishing every time there is a server thrown me out issue and Bethesda expecting me to pay in resources to put my house back down in exactly the same spot it shouldnt have vanished from.  Only once was someone else's camp in my spot.  Spending over 1000 caps in a day moving my camp over and over and never being able to place my small house down in any of these flat open areas.  Should refund the caps.  So no nice house for me.

Power armor that wont let you exit, preventing you from completing some quests that need you out of PA to use a terminal.  Bosses with quest items vanishing before you can loot forcing server hopping to actually finish your quest.  The Eye of Ra vanishing 3 times before I could finish the quest chain forcing me to go up into the mountains to retrieve over and over and the Garb of Mysteries refusing to be repaired and lets face it, by the time you are lev 25 to use it, its utter garbage compared even to leather armor.  Order of Mysteries ...FAIL

No Legendary hunting rifles in the game.  WTF.  So no TwoShot or Instigating for me ever and my TwoShot Dragon takes too long to reload.  Hopefully I get a TwoShot bolt action pipe rifle if I continue but honestly, there just isnt a weapon for me to look forward to finding.  So whats the point of the pathetic end game.

Danger warning bugged, sometimes for hours, travel 10 miles and its still danger but nothing attacks.  Scorchbeasts landing and attacking while it still says hidden or instantly detecting you while cameleon stealthed in a basement, are they Telepathic?  Maybe its the all seeing eye....

And whats with being hit several times per hour by nothing.  Did I sprain my ankle in Power Armor?  No real damage but makes you stop and search for enemies that arnt there.  And weight limit going down even though strength is not and theres no disease, mutation, addiction or debuff of any kind.  Fixed instantly by logging out then in.

And health going down constantly for no reason usually after Ive radaway'ed a lot of radiation.  Stims barely help and continues sometimes after logging out then in.  Ive played games more finished in early access.  Is that why you're afraid of Steam?

And how can I walk for 3 hours real time without seeing as much as a radsquirrel?  Ive scoffed in the past when people have called certain games a walking simulator but F76 really is.  Bethesda should try and sell this game to CD Projekt Red who care more for the fans than their bank account.  And my favourite thing Ive read online about 76.

Fallout 3 - Wheres my Dad?
Fallout 4 - Wheres my Son?
Fallout 76 - Wheres my refund?

K - Going back to Red Dead, Good luck guys - EB Games is giving me a refund today and cancelling Preorder for the Platinum guide :)  (shakes head)  And if any of you kiddies hears tick tick tickety on your common sense metres, pop some Radaway and start a Class Action to all get a refund together.  The legalese is "Product not fit for the purpose for which it is intended".  Peace

author: @TheInsomniaddict
comment:
I honestly don't know why anyone thought this game would be good.  As soon as I heard "multiplayer" I knew it'd be shit.  Bethesda games and worlds are not designed to be played by multiple people; their systems aren't fully balanced, can be taken advantage of, and are fun because of it.


You cannot make that into a fun experience for everyone unless you make something akin to a party game (eg, Genital Jousting).  Also, no mods.

On the bright side Joe, that helmet will probably be worth some money as a collector's item in 20 years.  Most people will have thrown theirs out or returned them by then.

comment:
frankly i am disappointed you were not hard enough on the game.
i am very poor irl on disability and it took 6 months of can collecting and doing things i cant even mention to  buy this i love fallout that much.   and it can take up to 3 hrs just to get in a fucking party with friends.  there is 0 pvp mostly ppl are helpful but about the time i take over something server crashes.  items randomly vanish i lost 58 power cores for NO reason .
i lost a full set of t60 NO reason. 

i get no loot on bomb raids cuz it cant load even with a beefy pc and great internet. this game is a fucking piece of shit.
     ¬†its SO bad  had i pirated it i would  wanted my time back. but now i stuck as i cant afford anything else its what i gotta deal with it,  fix the bugs it be fun but i dont see that happening. they are more worried about a arm being to long that the 2 fucking hrs it takes for me to get a party.+ everything is dark im legally blind  and when its night time fuck it even with a suit "light"  u cant see jack shit unless its a bright light lord help you if you own x01 armor you cannot seem to find one. 

with out cheating or glitching i have made it lvl 120 +  but frankly  its dull  and my camp budget is a joke you ether have a place to live OR defenses ya cant have both, on top of that the only good water collector forces you by water only about 10 spots in the game to use it so better be ok with dirty or toxic water.  heaven help you if you get parasites + diphtheria  41 min of just staying in camp so you dont randomly die.

make a another video and this time be angry cuz FUCK THIS GAME.. stole my damn money huge fallout fan.. i feel cheated.

Randall Graves: "State your name and latest game."

comment: In my opinion, about 90% of your 'points' are pointless and/or uneducated.  That blur in the distance takes 15 seconds to remove within the config ini, (and has nothing to do with the quality of your rig.  In-fact, it takes more rig to make DOF than not) same goes for the lighting and bloom effects among dozens of other tweaks you can make to excite your preferences.  You claim the game has terrible graphics, but it doesn't, the graphics and atmosphere is top shelf gorgeous.  You claim the game is boring, but there's hundreds of different ways you can play it.  You say there's bugs; well, name one online game that doesn't have bugs.   You say they aren't fixing anything, but they're constantly releasing fixes and QOL improvements.  You say you can't respec your character, they're adding this in a couple days.  You call them idiots, but you fail to understand the brilliance of the development of this game.  I realize my opinion isn't currently a popular one, but I very much enjoy this game and I'm glad I didn't listen too closely to your review when deciding whether to crawl out of that vault.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @TheNickazza
comment:
Who holds Bethesda in high regards? They have literally done nothing but anti-consumer shit the past like 5 years. Total Biscuit used to say it when no one else did. They havent released a single good game in technical regards. Like, you have the money, why not make ONE single game that dosent have SO MANY BUGS.

They have released the most boring game ever, skyrim, 4 times with little to value added, tried (and succeeded on xbox) to monetize mods and have consistently released buggy mess after buggy mess one after the other. Can anyone tell me about a SINGLE Early Access online open-world survival game that has survived longer than like 4 months with a 60 dollar pricetag that is THIS buggy? How come everyone else shits on the other games that actually try? How come super anti-consumer shit company Bethesda gets away with it? Like, i get the fallout and elderscrolls fanboying, but thats literally a lie. If ANYONE claims to be a fanboy or even a casual fan of these game they would hold them to ANY form of standard. I would LOVE a good ES game, a great fallout game but if they keep getting away with this garbage you will never, ever have a good Bethesda game, ever.

1: Repeating words does not make the point come across better, it just makes it annoying.
2: I've been playing this with one other person, and I haven't run into any of these bugs in the recent version. I haven't seen any "wendigo man", and I haven't run into T-Pose sliding enemies. 
3: I play Fo:76 for a new Fallout world. I'm not playing this game for an "interesting story." I never expected that from a Fallout MMO. Don't get me wrong, I love the stories in New Vegas, and I hope they don't use the "no NPC's" aspect again, but you can't expect a long, wonderous story to come out of an MMO.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Rantandum
comment:
This game looked like a hit-or-miss from the start, and I was actually gonna buy it if the reviews were good enough. But WOOOOOOW, this looks like a bad one!

I keep kicking myself for pre-ordering Evolve for the full price, but at the very least, Evolve had competent gameplay, stable graphics, and no game-breaking bugs (at least to my knowledge). But Fallout 76.....I mean, I can understand that Bethesda wants to branch out and expand their company, and a multiplayer Fallout game does sound fun, but this broken mess of a game should NOT be the end result of that wish. And I agree with Angry Joe; Bethesda is officially on probation. If their next game is another flop like this, or God forbid they screw up Elder Scrolls 6, then their company is in serious trouble.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Liamlucid
comment:
The only reason Bethesda made this game, was so modders couldn't release their great mods for free and Bethesda could monetize their awful mods instead. They've been trying to do this for many years already.

Bethesda are also under fire for refusing refunds to players who downloaded the game, well now we know why it's not on Steam.

They might actually be the worst company I've ever seen now, it's very clear they aren't the Bethesda they used to be.

Is every games company corrupt now? Valves Artefact just released and it's pay to win... As if Valve doesn't have enough fucking money, it blows my mind.

When did gaming turn into this?

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @neilchantry9869
comment:
Really, really sad! As a mid 50's gamer, I've been playing FPS and Adventure games since their inception. I've played good, bad & ugly games. The bad and ugly are usually from low end developing studios.
Bethesda, you have really dropped the ball on this. 

Really, Micro-transactions............. They're fine with a Free-To-Play but to put them into such an under-developed, un-enjoyable, terribly performing, under-delivering, High budget game............................... Just not acceptable!
I own pretty much all of your Elder Scrolls and Fallout products. I have enjoyed them all to a larger or lesser degree.
I WANT TO KNOW WHO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE LIES AND DELIBERATE MISLEADING STORIES DEFRAUDING LOYAL CUSTOMERS TO TRUST YOU UP FRONT? 
I believe 76 was marketed this way, because if it hit the market in the traditional manner, it would have never sold. Bethesda knew that!
THE PERSON OR TEAM GROUP THAT MADE THIS DECISION, NEED TO GO.
I WILL NOT BUY FALLOUT 5 OR ANY OTHER FUTURE BETHESDA GAMES UNTIL I SEE GREAT POSITIVE CONSENSUS ON REVIEWS.
If you do this lying, deceptive marketing again, Bethesda, will be finished, forever, with myself and my offspring.

I feel like the bugs aren't the problem. Yeah, it's buggy, so are a lot of games, and many are now revered.

The problems with this game are more fundamental: a multiplayer-only Fallout survival game should never exist. You should never take a long-running singleplayer franchise known for its intricate storyline, interesting characters, and dense RPG interactions, and strip it down to a free-roam multiplayer shooter.

Even if this game launched completely bug-free, it would've been crap.

The first review I've seen that the reviewer put more then 4 hours into the game and isn't going for a worse cash grab then the ing game mtx. The other lack of legendary drops, having to choose to farm gear or kill a glitched out flying dragon that you have a 70pct chance of dc'ing in the 15-30 min fight is what will kill this game. 

My voice will never be heard by Bethedsa but Thank you Joe for bringing it up so they might fix it. I've put over 200 hours in so far and I'm willing to far 500 more beliving this game will get better.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @aspitefulrose7001
comment:
A classic Angry Joe review. Back to the bread and butter that made this channel great to begin with.

I had unsubscribed during the Battlefield 5 bullshit. That was the point where my patience had ran out. Stay away out of politics, Joe. You're out of touch, don't know what you're talking about, and pissing on your own community. That or you actually know what's up but are toeing the line for the sake of sheckles. Either way, you're wrong.

This, Joe, this 40 minute fuckfest of rage, criticism, and consumer advocacy... this is what made you great. This is what us old fans first subbed for.

Now, on to the subject itself...
Idk why anyone was shocked by this. I mean, yes, 76 is worse than I expected it to be. I expected 76 to be a bit messy and boring, but it turned out to be... holy shit, this mess... But, what I mean is, I don't get why anyone was excited for and thought this was going to be GOOD.

Who's behind this game? First and foremost? Bethesda. What's Bethesda known for? OFFLINE, SINGLE PLAYER games that are actually quite mediocre in a lot of ways, but have this unique magic in a bottle experience to them that sucks a player in so well that they can overlook its numerous and glaring faults. Bethesda's games are notoriously buggy and poorly polished; always have been. They are notorious for having a lot of half-baked shit in them; always have been. I could go on. But, again, they still have a particular magic in a bottle feeling to them. It's what's driven the modding community to stick with Bethesda games and go absolute apeshit pushing them to their limits. I'm currently 76 hours (oh, what a coincidence) into my Skyrim SE fresh playthrough with a load order of 150 mods. There is nothing, I mean NOTHING that I have ever played that can compare to my install of Skyrim SE. But why is it that good? Because, at the end of the day, what Bethesda is REALLY known for, is creating mediocre games that are the perfect sandbox and toolset for modders to fix, modify, expand, and personalize. I can't play Skyrim without mods. Just can't do it. Oblivion, too. They're both dreadful in comparison to what else in my library I could be playing. But with mods, as I said... nothing can compare. Interestingly enough, Morrowing.. that ancient relic... is the only one I can play without mods (except graphics mods; I use those regardless). And even Morrowind I use a few light mods on.

Point is, it's Bethesda... You should have seen this coming. Now lets move on to ZeniMax. Where do we know them from when it comes to online shit from Bethesda? Oh, that's right! FUCKING TES: ONLINE!!! Yeah, you remember that mess?

Bethesda + ZeniMax + FALLOUT 4!!!! + ONLINE!!! = WHAT DID YOU EXPECT????
As I said, I didn't expect it to be THIS bad... But I can't sympathize with anyone who actually expected this to be GOOD.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @Sines314
comment:
I'm actually quite enjoying the game. However I will not deny that it is hugely flawed. Some mistakes which might be acceptable for an indie developer get no such excuse when sold as a full priced game by a major studio like Bethesda. That being said, if I'm willing to tolerate those flaws and still enjoy other games, then I can tolerate them here.

Now, I will 'defend' Fallout 76 in one way I haven't seen other people note. The games bizarre commitment to no human NPCs (there are NPCs, just no human ones) and missing dialogue trees seems like a huge problem. However, that's only if you're comparing Fallout 76 to New Vegas. I instead chose to compare it to Fallout 4, and frankly, the lack of NPCs and dialogue is only a very minor problem. Fallout 4 had a very mediocre story, the only good parts of it were the non-interactable scripted parts, like the logs in Vault 88, or Kellogs memories. Not being able to interact with NPCs is really just a sidestep to being able to interact with crappy NPCs.

Bethesda is terrible at telling a story where you have actual choice in it, but they're not bad at telling stories that happen regardless of your actions. I'd rather have Bethesda just hire someone who knows how to write a good story, but I knew that wasn't going to happen. So honestly, Bethesda just cutting their mediocre attempts at telling a story out of the game, to make room for parts of game-making they're good at, is not a bad thing.

I know, it's shallow praise. As is the praise for the rest of the game (except the Perk cards, which I really like). But that's how I've seen Bethesda for years now. Games that both leave me incredibly disappointed, and yet still enjoying them. So I don't feel my money is wasted. But I'm sure as hell not going to be unhappy if Bethesda is forced to evolve or die. I was fine with them where they were, but the loss of Bethesda studios is not going to ruin my gaming life. I'd rather take a gamble that they course correct rather than die.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @arbiteras
comment:
Joe, this happens because gamers now excuse EVERYTHING and by buying DLC\microtransations\other bullshit you essentially giving them the pass to do what they want, they know you'll buy everything, so they put the minimum effort as possible to cash in the fans passion for this series.
People buy their shit thinking it's going to be great when they want to screw you, or buy DLC because people apparently have the urge to throw away money for stuff that 10 years ago was in the base game but now removed for $$$$.
  
If you want Bethesda to get better, don't fucking buy their game, there's no worse "punishment" for a gaming company that their game is a selling failure, this way they'll understand you don't buy garbage and you, the customer deserve respect!
 But if you give them 200$ and expect it's going to be better it's useless, it solves nothing, STOP BUYING THEIR GAMES; LIKE EA!!!

It's as if you were going to a restaraunt that over time has been serving meals that got shittier and expensive as time went on and every week you eat there you expect it to get better when you get out with even less money and not satisfied. 
I've stopped buying games (especially anything from EA) because of the microtransations bullshit, this way i'm telling them that i don't tolerate that shit in a game.

Do what i do, get smarter and you'll not be ripped off, i love gaming and it's a dark time for us, all companies are giving us the finger and try to screw over because of easy cash.
