title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @darkrite9000
comment:
Okay to those unaware, Bethesda isn't the same thing as Bethesda Game Studios, and by extension their Austin branch. How so, well Bethesda publishing, which Todd is the face for, is just that, the publisher, it's just like EA or Activision. Bethesda Game Studios is reponsible for making every numbered elder scrolls and fallout game (as in 1,2,.. 4,5, etc.) so Fallout New Vegas wasn't made by them, it was made by Obsidian studios, and published by Bethesda. Same goes for ESO and Fallout 76, reason being, Fallout 76 was primarily handled by the Austin branch. Which once upon a time was a different game studio, their game didn't work out and so became part of Bethesda. They had no experience with the creation engine, and were given a short time-frame, they tried to rip it apart and put it back together in a way that they assumed would work well for multiplayer. Suffice to say, that ended up being a very bad idea. 

This is why this game is so bad, yes Bethesda games are buggy, but it's not the engine's fault, even with a dated engine, you can still make a top-notch game. The problem lies in those that work on it, reason being, a game can range from running smooth as silk, to rough and buggy as hell. If you spend more time bug-fixing and tweaking things then you get a better game. Even after release every true Bethesda game has had bugs, but also patches and updates that fix them (or put them back in if the people ask for it, like Skyrim's space program via giants). Sure they don't get all the bugs, but what they don't get, the modding community does (and obviously modders must use the same engine as it's the game's engine, so the engine really isn't the problem). So improving the engine or making a new one may help, but ultimately it falls down to what you do with the engine. Bethesda Game Studios makes good games using their engine, the Austin branch failed badly. I never experienced some of the bugs others had faced in Skyrim or Fallout 4, obviously without the community patch, but there's plenty I did. Either way this game is a mess.

Now we know why it's this way, they (being the Austin branch) obviously didn't have enough experience with the engine, and not enough time to make this. Does that make this anymore acceptable, no, it doesn't. It just tells us what went wrong, and makes us more understanding, but something is still very much wrong. As such it's a bad game, it's still a game, you can still enjoy it, but it's unlikely. I still have high hopes for any true Bethesda game, but any game which is made primarily by one of the separate branches, is another story. This is gonna be a blemish on Bethesda's otherwise decent record, even if it's not the actual primary studio that did this, it still stings.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @DerivativeMVs
comment:
We all dream for another Oblivion or Fallout 3 experience, and blindly hope that Bethseda will eventually make it happen again, but their values have just sunk so far.
Skyrim and FO4 had very lackluster character dialogue and were far too linear to be called "Adventure" games. We need to be left in the dark on certain details in quests; given a reason to explore, not constantly be guided down narrow dungeons and questlines. Then there's the recent money grubbing with the paid mods and 76.
Bethseda has lost all interest in making exciting adventure games. They just want to funnel us through linear gameplays and bore us enough to make buying mods a must in order to add some diversity to the experience. 
To be fair, though, Skyrim did keep me for a good while. I mastered the shit out of it, but then I went back and played Oblivion again on a whim, and realized just how lacking Skyrim is by comparison. ESPECIALLY the Shivering Isles DLC in Oblivion. That DLC is the pinnacle of what all DLC in games should aspire to be, and I would play that DLC alone above Skyrim, FO4, and 76: none of them come close to its quality in design, writing, and as just an amazing experience.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @fireyourrocketts
comment: LOL...This wonderful video proof there is always something good to have out of anything awful, I laughed so hard, the video have made for the frustration I have playing this POS excuse of game. Finally a youtube video telling them like it is. We should all sue them. A class action sue where they are obligated to refund the money they stole from us. That would teach them not to release an unfinished game ever. After this, no more titles from Bethesda for me. Got my copy from Game Stop but managed to reseal it and refund it, then bought a discounted copy from Best Buy which I am assured I can return up to January 12 even if it is opened but if I am not, will be trading my copy towards Just Cause 4. Of course it would probably be worth nothing because the prices keep dropping as we speak; it won't be long until this game hits $20.00 mark. I do not even care for Bethesda to fix it any more. Damage is done and that is on them. Fuck Bethesda and all who participated in this big disappointment! Dude, you are not a troll at all; those kids hammering you for this review are just that; kids; I can not think of anyone who works for their money condoning such an atrocity like this game! we ALL wanted this game to be good, we waited for it and we were laughed at; there is no way those people in Bethesda don't know what they were doing in releasing a fucked up product and I hope they get the worst from consumer laws and reviews. When you do not respect your customers like this, do not deserve to have a business. Hope they all go to hell for what they did, or better yet for what they did not do, which was to provide a quality product. ---  Hey just wondering how you got Charlie Sheen to be in the video????

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @seiggrainhart4719
comment:
Okay... I'm legitimately confused.
Fallout 76 is Bethesda's first true MMO game made in-house.
Bethesda is known for bloody buggy as hell releases, with most bugs still being around months afterward. (Hell, New Vegas STILL has some game-breaking bugs.)
Fallout 76 is an MMO games. MMO games are known to use beta testers to make sure the game is actually working.
Fallout 76's cash shop that you complained about? None of it actually affects the game beyond making you and your guns look cool. Nothing else.
They legit said there'll be no NPCs.

Did they promise that the game wouldn't be buggy on release? Yes, but they had a too short public beta phase. (Most MMO games have a 1~2 YEAR long Beta phase before release.)
The only legitimate issue that exists with the game is that. Everything else is Bethesda being Bethesda. Get the fucking hell over it. It's their first in-house MMO, the next one might be better. But there won't be a next one if people keep complaining about Bethesda being Bethesda.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @phatdog
comment:
To put it short its like one of those fun broken games that you play with friends and enjoy mucking around with it but it gets boring if your actually wanting to enjoy some good fallout lore, I myself haven't experienced most of these bugs on xbox and every game is broken at launch but it is sad that they ported a lot of bugs from fallout 4 and performance wise it is very bad. To make things worst they allowed mods to fix these issues in fallout 4 so why didn't they just hire the people who fixed them to fix the fallout 76 issues? If they can port the bugs from the previous game then they can port the patch that the community has made to fix it.

Overall I enjoy it, still playing with friends and having fun but its not worth full price hands down. Its a rushed money grab game

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @KnightWhoSaysREEE
comment: This game has many, many, MANY flaws. However, the game is exactly how I thought it would be. Its a Fallout world that's multiplayer and has no human NPCs, after hearing that I assumed it would just be a fun game to explore a post apocalyptic world with friends. I did NOT expect a great story/campaign being that there are NO HUMAN NPCs, I also did NOT expect the game to be any less buggy than previous Bethesda games (you haven't experienced Bethesda until you experience some hilarious bugs). All I'm saying is maybe wait until the game is released before spending $60+ on it, especially considering everyone was a little skeptical about this game since it was announced. I'm not necessarily defending the game, just recommending everyone do their research before buying a game, seems a lot of games of late have been falling short of expectations.

title: Fallout 76 Angry Review
author: @TheArceusftw
comment:
I would compare this game to the likes of Sonic the Hedgehog 2006, or Big Rigs Over the Road Racing, but would be an insult! At least with Sonic 06 or Big Rigs, you can atleast laugh at how absurdly broken they were and get some "So bad it's good" enjoyment out of it! This game is more or less a $60.00 broken promise! This looks like a Steam Greenlight with a beefed up budget! And Bethesda shipped this out in this state?! I would expect this sort of crap from EA, or Digital Homicide! It would be like if Rockstar announced Grand Theft Auto VI, and the finished product looked like Ride to Hell Retribution! If any other company had the AUDACITY to sell a game this Eighted-assed at FULL PRICE I would probably have the same reaction!(IN FACT, I'M GLAD THIS GAME DOESN'T HAVE A SWITCH PORT!)
GRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGH!
(Powers up to Ultra Super Saiyan Blue 4 Evolution x100Kaioken)
THERE'S ONLY ONE PUNISHMENT FOR THIS DUMPSTER FIRE!
X100,000,000,000,000 BIG BANG GALICK FINAL SPIRIT KAMEHAMEHA!!!
